This includes adding, accepting and rejecting proof, correcting an error if the acceptance status is incorrect, and deleting proof. What you need to know Cúram will prompt verification requirements for certain proof, such as Third Party Contact and SIN Identification Status. Note: You do not need to perform SIN identification verification for Release 1. Step by Step What you need to do Accept or Reject Proof Updated In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Evidence tab. Click Verifications in the page group navigation bar to access items that are available for verification. Click on the 3 dots ( … ) action menu for the evidence you wish to verify and click Add Proof . The Add Proof wizard opens. Date Received Updated Indicate the date on which the item was received from the provider. New Provided by New Indicate the name of the person providing the evidence by performing one of the following actions: If the person is registered in the system, click the magnifying glass icon under Participant. The Person Search wizard appears. Refer to Search a Person in Curam. Select the provider’s name; or If the person is not register, enter the person’s full name under Name . Modify Verification Status of Proof In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Evidence tab. Click Verifications in the page group navigation bar to access items that are available for verification. Click the arrow icon next to the item you wish to modify. The item will expand the details. Under Verification Items Received, click the arrow icon on the proof to access the details of the attachment. Click on the 3 dots ( … ) action menu under Attachments and click Edit . The Edit Attachment Details wizard opens. Click on the arrow icon under Acceptance Status and make the necessary changes. Note: If the Acceptance Status is Rejected , you must select a reason from the Rejection Reason drop down menu. Note: You can also modify any of the other fields in the wizard, if needed. Click Save . The attachment under Verification Items Received is now displayed as Accepted or Rejected under Acceptance Status . The Item Status is changed to Verified if it was accepted or Not Verified if the status was changed to rejected. Delete Proof In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Evidence tab. Click Verifications in the page group navigation bar to access items that are available for verification. Click the arrow icon next to the item you wish to delete. The item will expand details. Under Verification Items Received, click the arrow icon on the proof to access the details of the attachment. Click on the 3 dot ( … ) action menu under Attachments and click Delete . The Delete Attachment window opens. Click Yes . The proof is now deleted. Note: The evidence will still exist, but the status appears as cancelled. References There is no reference material. (KA-01423 Snippet 14.0 content. It also provides you with the steps to view, edit or delete the periods. What you need to know Updated In Cúram, Canadian residence periods in an FEC are used to capture Canadian residence that was reported to a foreign country on a liaison. Updated You can add, view, edit or delete Canadian residence periods in the Evidence tab of the FEC for the applicable country. Updated After a Canadian residence period is added, changed or deleted, it must be activated in Cúram before it can be used to adjudicate OAS/CPP applications under a Social Security Agreement. There are no limits to how many entries you can make and how many gaps in residence periods are allowed. If a Canadian residence period overlaps with a foreign contribution period, an issue will be raised on the Evidence Dashboard. This must be resolved before the evidence can be activated. Refer to Residence Period—Add, View and Edit in Cúram (Action) . Updated Each Canadian residence period can have multiple statuses, as indicated by the icons below. Table 1—Canadian Residence Periods Statuses Status Description In Edit Evidence The evidence has been saved but has not been activated. Verifications The evidence requires verification before it can be activated. Issues The evidence contains incomplete or incorrect information. Evidence with and issue cannot be activated until the issue is resolved. Active Evidence Updated The Canadian Residence Period evidence has been activated. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Add a Canadian Residence Period Updated In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) on the Person’s account will appear in the content page beneath the navigation bar. Updated Click on the correct FEC under the Reference column. The FEC opens. Click the Evidence tab. Hover over Canadian Residence Period . A plus ( + ) icon appears. Click the plus ( + ) icon. The New Canadian Residence Period wizard appears. Note: If you click on the Canadian Residence Period hyperlink, the Canadian Residence Period page opens. This is not the correct action for this step. You must click the plus ( + ) icon. Enter the information in the wizard as follows: Table 2. Field and Direction under Canadian Residence Period section Field Direction Date Received Mandatory Today’s date is automatically filled. If this is not correct, select the correct date. Case Participant Field Direction Participant Mandatory Select or enter the name of the person from the dropdown menu. Canadian Residence Period Details Field Direction Residence Type Mandatory Select the following Residence Type: Residence ; Presence ; Absence ; or Deemed Residence . Start Date Mandatory Select the date the residence period began. End Date Mandatory Select the date the residence period ended. Comments Enter additional comments, if applicable. Click Save if you are done adding residence periods or click Save &amp; New to save the residence period and add another one. When the wizard closes and the Evidence page appears, a crayon icon appears next to the Canadian Residence Period indicating that the evidence is in edit mode. H2 Exp-coll: Activate a Canadian Residence Period Updated In Cúram, access the Person’s profile . Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . New Click the Cases and Applications tab. Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) on the Person’s account will appear in the content page beneath the navigation bar. New Click the correct FEC under the Reference column. New Click the Evidence tab. New Click In Edit Evidence on the page group navigation bar on the left. The In Edit Evidence window opens. New Click Apply Evidence Changes... on the top right of the context panel to display the action menu. Select the Canadian Residence Period to activate that period. Click Save . The residence period is active and appears in the Active Evidence section. New Note: After activation, Canadian residence periods are shared as Active Evidence across all FECs for the client. H2 Exp-coll: View a Canadian Residence Period Updated In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) on the Person’s account will appear in the content page beneath the navigation bar. Under Reference click the correct FEC. The FEC opens. Click the Evidence tab. From the Dashboard , click the Canadian Residence Period hyperlink. The Canadian Residence Period—Foreign Engagement Case # page opens. Note: Do not click the plus ( + ) icon. Ensure you click the hyperlink to access the Canadian Residence Period details. Updated Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon to expand the details. H2 Exp-coll: Edit a Canadian Residence Period Updated In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) on the Person’s account will appear in the content page beneath the navigation bar. Under Reference click the correct FEC. The FEC opens. Click the Evidence tab. From the Dashboard , click the Canadian Residence Period hyperlink. The Canadian - Residence Period—Foreign Engagement Case # page opens. Note: Do not click the plus ( + ) icon. Ensure you click the hyperlink to access the Canadian Residence Period details. Updated Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon to expand the details. Click the 3 dots ( … )  action menu action menu and click Edit . The Edit Canadian Residence Period wizard opens. Updated Note: If the period has not been activated, the action will be Continue Editing instead of Edit . New Make the necessary updates to the Canadian residence period evidence. Updated Click Save . Refer to the Activate a Canadian Residence Period section above to activate the evidence. H2 Exp-coll: Delete a Canadian Residence Period Updated In Cúram, access the Person’s profile.  Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) on the Person’s account will appear in the content page beneath the navigation bar. Under Reference click the correct FEC. The FEC opens. Click the Evidence tab. From the Dashboard , click the Canadian Residence Period hyperlink. The Canadian Residence Period—Foreign Engagement Case # page opens. Note: Do not click on the plus ( + ) icon. Ensure you click the hyperlink to access the Canadian Residence Period details. Updated Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon to expand the details. Updated Click the 3 dots ( … ) action menu and click Delete . The Delete Active Evidence wizard opens. Updated Note: If the period has not been activated, the action will be Discard instead of Delete and the Discard Evidence wizard will open. Updated Click Yes . The deleted Canadian residence period evidence will require activation to be completely deleted in Cúram. Refer to the Activate a Canadian Residence Period section above. Do not modify or delete.)</content></document><document><reference>https://kmt-ogc.service.gc.ca/en/knowledgebase/article-latest?pid=KA-05221&amp;cid=CAT-01960</reference><title>Liaison—Add, Modify, Access and Delete in Cúram (Action)</title><video_link>['https://014gc.sharepoint.com/sites/95530/Howto%20Clips/How-to%20Clips/Processing/Processors/Evidence/Add%20modify%20delete%20a%20Foreign%20Liaison.mp4']</video_link><video_name>['Add modify delete a Foreign Liaison']</video_name><walkme_flow_id>[-1]</walkme_flow_id><walkme_flow_name>['placeholder']</walkme_flow_name><content>Overview Summary This procedure provides you with steps to create, view, modify and delete incoming and outgoing liaisons in Cúram. What you need to know Incoming and outgoing foreign liaisons are associated with a Foreign Engagement Case (FEC) for a Person or Prospect Person in Cúram. The mail room staff receives a foreign benefit application or liaison, registers the Person or Prospect Person’s profile if applicable, creates a specific FEC, and uploads the scanned documents as attachments in the FEC. This will create a task in Cúram which is then assigned accordingly. Note: If the client already exists in Cúram, you do not need to register the client again. Refer to Register a Person in Cúram (Action) and Attachments—Add, View, Modify, Delete, Move and Search in Cúram (Action) . Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Add a Foreign Liaison Updated In Cúram, go to the person’s Profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click Cases and Applications . Click on the case number hyperlink under Reference. The Foreign Engagement Case home page opens in a new tab. Click Foreign Benefits . The Foreign Applications page opens by default. Updated Click Foreign Liaisons from the left navigation menu. Click New… on the right side of the section. The New Foreign Liaison wizard opens. Enter the information under the Liaison Information tab as follows: Table 1. Field and Direction under Liaison Information tab Field Direction Date Mandatory Select the date when you received the incoming liaison or when you are sending the outgoing liaison. Foreign Identifier Select the foreign identifier, if available. Note: If the foreign identifier is not listed, add the foreign identifier in the Person’s Identification evidence. Refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . Foreign Office Select the applicable foreign office from the drop-down menu. Direction Select one of the following options: Incoming Outgoing BESS Check this box if the liaison is sent to the Bureau des ententes de sécurité sociale (BESS) for processing. Note: You must not check the BESS box if Direction is Outgoing . Foreign Application Select the appropriate foreign application created under the Foreign Engagement Case (FEC), if the applicable liaison is outgoing and is related to sending a foreign benefit application. Liaison Reference Select any linking previous incoming liaisons to corresponding outgoing liaisons. Comment Enter additional notes, if applicable. Click Next . The Liaison Checklist tab opens. Check the items applicable to the liaison to indicate the liaison subjects: Address Appealed Application Canadian Benefit Rates Contributions Date of Birth Date of Death Date of Receipt Decision – Approval of Foreign Benefit(s) Decision – Denial of Foreign Benefit(s) Foreign Pension Rates Medical Appointment Medical Documentation Next of Kin Other (description required below) Note: You must select Other when providing the foreign institution with a Canadian pension or benefit denial decision. Protective Date Note: If a protective date is being provided by the foreign institution, do not enter the date in the Description section of the Liaison Checklist or in ITRDS Notes. Residence Note: You can select more than one item on the checklist. Enter the detailed description under Description if you select Other under Liaison Checklist. Click Next . The Attachments tab opens which lists all scanned documents in the FEC. Select the applicable attachments, if applicable. Click Save . A record of the foreign liaison appears in the Foreign Liaisons section. The Direction indicates if the liaison is Outgoing or Incoming. New Note: You will need to add attachments to the attachments window under Foreign Benefits. Once an attachment has been uploaded, it can be added to a Foreign Liaisons case at this stage. H2 Exp-coll: Access a Foreign Liaison Updated In Cúram, go to the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click Cases and Applications . Click on the case number hyperlink under Reference. The Foreign Engagement Case home page opens in a new tab. Click Foreign Benefits . The Foreign Applications page opens by default. Updated Click Foreign Liaisons from the left navigation menu. Click the arrow icon to expand the liaison. The following 3 tabs in a smaller sized font open: The Details tab display the liaison information and the checklist items that were entered during the creation process. The Attachments tab lists the related attachments that were selected during the creation process. New Note: You will need to add attachments to the attachments window under Foreign Benefits. Once an attachment has been uploaded, it can be added to a Foreign Liaisons case and will appear for Foreign Liaisons to select at this stage. The History tab records the history of changes for this specific liaison. H2 Exp-coll: Modify a Foreign Liaison In Cúram, go to the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click Cases and Applications . Click on the case number hyperlink under Reference. The Foreign Engagement Case home page will open in a new tab. Click Foreign Benefits . The Foreign Applications page appears by default. Click Foreign Liaisons . Click Edit at the end of the liaison. The Edit Foreign Liaison wizard opens. Note: The Edit Foreign Liaison’s wizard fields are identical to the ones in the New Foreign Liaison wizard. Modify the applicable fields as needed. Click Save and Close . H2 Exp-coll: Delete a Foreign Liaison In Cúram, go to the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click Cases and Applications . Click on the case number hyperlink under Reference. The Foreign Engagement Case home page opens in a new tab. Click the Foreign Benefits tab. The Foreign Applications page opens by default. Click Foreign Liaisons . Click the 3 dots ( … ) action menu at the end of the liaison and select Delete . The Delete Foreign Liaison window opens. Click Yes to delete the Foreign Liaison. The Status of the liaison changes from Active to Canceled . Top tab: References There is no reference material. (KA-01423 Snippet 14.0 content. What you need to know Updated When a Foreign Engagement Case (FEC) is created for a specific country, you can add a foreign benefit application for that country in the FEC to capture the details of the foreign benefit application. Updated Interim as an Application Type is available for all countries regardless of whether Canada has an International Social Security Agreement with the selected country. Updated Foreign benefit application records have the following statuses: Table 1—Status Type and Description Status Type Description Open When the application is initially created. In Progress When a task is triggered related to the application, such as the upload of an attachment. On Hold When the related task is deferred, such as when awaiting further information. Completed When an outgoing liaison record is created indicating the application is sent. Cancelled When an application has been deleted. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Add a foreign benefit application Updated In Cúram, access the person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Updated Click the Cases and Applications tab. Locate the specific Foreign Engagement Case (FEC) for the foreign benefit request. Click the case number hyperlink in the Reference column next to the specific FEC. The FEC home page opens in a new tab in the tab title bar. Click the Foreign Benefits tab. The Foreign Applications details open. Click the Foreign Applications tab on page group navigation bar. Note: When you click the Foreign Benefits tab in Step 5 , the Foreign Applications details should appear by default. Updated Click New… on the right side of the content page. The New Foreign Benefit Application wizard appears. Enter the required information in the wizard as follows: Table 1—Field and Direction for the New Foreign Application wizard Field Direction Updated Date Received Mandatory Select the date that the new application was received. Application Type Mandatory Select the type of the foreign benefit application from the drop-down menu. The options will vary based on the selected country. If you select Interim as an Application Type , the following optional fields become available: Retirement or Old Age ; Disability ; Survivors ; and Other . If you select Other , you must enter a description under the Specify field. The Consent section appears for United States Interim applications. Applicant’s Foreign Identifier Select the applicant’s foreign identifier associated with the foreign country, if available. The applicant’s Foreign Identifier field is subject to the following: The content of the drop-down list changes based on the person’s identification information. The list is based on the identification evidence in the person’s profile. If there is no identification evidence, the drop-down list will be empty. Note: If a person’s foreign identifier is known when creating the foreign application, add the foreign identifier to the person’s evidence before proceeding. Foreign Office Select the foreign office associated to the foreign benefit, if available. The Foreign Office field is subject to the following: The drop-down list will be dynamically displayed. The list of offices is associated with a specific foreign country. BESS Check this box if the entire application is sent to the Bureau des ententes de sécurité sociale (BESS) for processing. Note: The BESS checkbox must not be checked if a Foreign Office is entered. Comments Enter additional comments as needed. Click Save . H2 Exp-coll: View a foreign benefit application Updated In Cúram, go to the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Updated Click the Cases and Applications tab. Find the specific Foreign Engagement Case (FEC) for the foreign benefit request. Click the case number hyperlink from the Reference column next to the specific FEC. The FEC home page opens in a new tab in the tab title bar. Updated Click Foreign Benefits . Click Foreign Applications . Updated Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon to expand and view the application. The following 2 tabs in a smaller sized font open: The Details tab displays the foreign application information. The History tab records the history of changes to the application record. The FEC home page opens in a new tab in the tab title bar. Updated Click Foreign Benefits . Click Foreign Applications . Updated Click Edit at the end of the application. The Edit Foreign Application wizard opens. Note: The Edit Foreign Application wizard’s fields are identical to the ones in the New Foreign Application wizard. Modify the applicable fields as needed. Click Save . H2 Exp-coll: Delete a foreign benefit application Updated In Cúram, go to the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Updated Click the Cases and Applications tab. Locate the specific Foreign Engagement Case (FEC) for the foreign benefit request. Do not modify or delete.)</content></document><document><reference>https://kmt-ogc.service.gc.ca/en/knowledgebase/article-latest?pid=KA-05229&amp;cid=CAT-01959</reference><title>Resolve Issues for Foreign Contribution and Canadian Residence Periods on a Foreign Engagement Case in Cúram (Action)</title><video_link>[-1]</video_link><video_name>['placeholder']</video_name><walkme_flow_id>[-1]</walkme_flow_id><walkme_flow_name>['placeholder']</walkme_flow_name><content>Overview Summary This procedure provides you with the steps to resolve an issue with overlapping Canadian residence and contribution periods. What you need to know If a contribution period and a Canadian residence period overlap, an issue will be raised in Cúram. When activating either period, you will be prompted to resolve the issue. The issue will always need to be resolved on the Canadian residence period. Once it has been resolved, you will need to reactivate the period. If you add an overlapping contribution period after the Canadian residence period has already been activated, you will need to resolve the issue from Active Evidence in the page group navigation bar. If you add an overlapping Canadian residence period after the contribution period has already been activated, you will need to resolve the issue from In Edit Evidence in the page group navigation bar. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Resolve an Issue for an Activated Contribution Period Updated In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) on the Person’s profile will appear in the content page beneath the navigation bar. Under Reference, click the correct FEC. The FEC opens. Click the Evidence tab. Click In Edit Evidence from the page group navigation bar. Note: A flag icon will appear next to the Canadian residence period that has an issue. Updated Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon next to the appropriate evidence. Click the 3 dots ( … ) action menu under Change Summary and click Continue Editing... . The Edit Canadian Residence Period wizard opens. Edit the dates to resolve the overlap or enter the information under Issue Resolution Details as follows to accept the issue: Issue Resolution Details Field Direction Resolution Select Overlap Resolved if you have taken action and resolved the overlap. Select Acceptable Overlap if you have reviewed the evidence and decided the overlap is acceptable (no action taken). Select Overlap Reviewed/Action Taken if you have taken action but the issue has not been resolved. Click Save . Click Dashboard from the page group navigation bar. Click the 3 dots ( … ) action menu and click Apply Changes... . The Apply Changes wizard opens. Select the appropriate Canadian residence period to activate it. Click Save . The residence period is active, the issue is resolved, and it appears in the Active Evidence section. H2 Exp-coll: Resolve an Issue for an Activated Canadian Residence Period Updated In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) on the Person’s account will appear in the content page beneath the navigation bar. Under Reference, click the correct FEC. The FEC opens. Click the Evidence tab. Click Active Evidence from the page group navigation bar. Note: A flag icon will appear next to the Canadian residence period that has an issue. Updated Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon next to the appropriate evidence and click the 3 dots ( … ) action menu under Change Summary and click Edit... . The Edit Canadian Residence Period wizard opens. Edit the dates to resolve the overlap or enter the information under Issue Resolution Details as follows to accept the issue: Issue Resolution Details Field Direction Resolution Select Overlap Resolved if you have taken action and resolved the overlap. What you need to know When a liaison, a foreign benefit application, foreign benefit decisions or documentation from a foreign institution or a client is received, you will process the information based on one of the following scenarios: If the client does not exist in Cúram, you should register the client and creates an FEC based on the information. If the client exists in the system but does not have an FEC related to the required country, you must create an FEC based on the country information. If the client exists in the system and has the specific FEC in their profile, you must update the existing FEC. You must also register the client and create the FEC if an enquiry is received for a country with which Canada does not have an International Social Security Agreement in force (e.g. a kit request for a non-agreement country). Do not register the client or create an FEC when: the account has a Country of Agreement code of 099 or 61 ; or the work item received is not related to a foreign benefit application or liaison. If the client does not exist in Cúram, they can be registered as a Person or Prospect Person. The client will be registered as a Prospect Person if: the FEC Country is one of the 3 restricted countries (the United States, Japan and Jamaica); and liaisons, foreign benefit decisions and/or documentations are received directly from one of those country's foreign institutions. This includes merging records with Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) for the same and different countries. What you need to know You must mark a record as a duplicate before you can perform a record merge. R efer to Manage Duplicate Person Records in Cúram (Action) . The merge functionality is manual because it must not be used frequently. When you register a new Person in Cúram you must search to see if the record already exists to avoid issues of duplication. You cannot merge a duplicate Person when they have open tasks on their record or FECs. You must close all cases and tasks before you can proceed. You cannot merge a duplicate if there is a temporary SIN on one Person record and no SIN on the other, or if there is a temporary SIN on both records. A prospect Person record must first be registered as a Person before their record can be selected as the original record. Refer to Register a Prospect Person as a Person in Cúram (Action) . Cúram will update the Comment fields of evidences on the record to indicate that a merge was performed. All communication will be copied to the master Person’s record. Birth and Death Details, Contact Pre ferences, Gender Details, Marital Status, and Third Party Contact are not available to merge. They will need to be modified or added on the master Person’s record. Refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) and Third Party Contacts—Add, View, Edit, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . All the FEC from the duplicate record will be added to the master record. You can still open the FECs but the home page displays the message “This case belongs to a Duplicate Person. Do not perform any updates on this case. Find the Master Person and make updates to the Master Person’s FEC.” You must recreate the FEC on the master Person’s record. You can use the duplicate FEC to recreate the information. Refer to Foreign Engagement Case — Add, View, Edit and Close in Cúram (Action) and Foreign Benefit Application—Add, Access, Modify, and Delete in Cúram . Step by Step What you need to do Merge Records In Cúram, access the master Person's record. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click Administration . Click Duplicates from the page group navigation bar. Click the 3 dots ( … ) action menu at the end of the row for the duplicate Person you want to merge. A pop-up menu opens. Click Start Merge . A wizard opens. Note: This wizard populates all the evidence that can be merged for both records and prompts you to select which evidence from the duplicate Person you want to keep. It will display all the evidence that is available (e.g. if there is no marital status included on either record, there will be no option to merge marital status). Follow the steps below for the evidences applicable to your situation: Note: You will get an error message if you try to add addresses of the same type for an overlapping period. Addresses must have end dates, otherwise the current address on the master Person's record will need to have an end date added (i.e. you cannot have 2 current addresses) Addresses Field Direction Addresses This field cannot be edited. It displays the addresses on the master Person's record. Merge Addresses Select the addresses from the duplicate that you want to merge. Click Next . Note: If a SIN already exists on the master Person’s record, you cannot merge the one from the duplicate Person. If the master Person's record did not have a SIN, you will be prompted to add the one from the duplicate before you can proceed. Identification Field Direction Identification This field cannot be edited. It displays the identification on the master Person's record. Merge Identifications Select the identifications from the duplicate that you want to merge. Click Next . Names Field Direction Names This field cannot be edited. It displays the names on the master Person's record. Merge Names Select the names from the duplicate that you want to merge. Click Next . Email Addresses Field Direction Email Address This field cannot be edited. It displays the email addresses on the master Person's record. Merge Email Addresses Select the email addresses from the duplicate that you want to merge. Click Next . Phone Numbers Field Direction Phone Number This field cannot be edited. It displays the phone numbers on the master Person's record. Merge Phone Numbers Select the phone numbers from the duplicate that you want to merge. Click Next . Click Complete Merge . The 2 records are now merged. You can view the merged record details under the Administration tab. Access Merged FECs to Update Master Person’s Record In Cúram, access the master Person. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click Cases and Applications . All Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) from the duplicate record appear alongside the FECs added to the master Person’s record. Note: The Case Participant column indicates if the FEC was originally created on  the master record or the duplicate record. Click on the reference number to open the merged case to update the master Person’s record. Note: All attachments on the duplicate FECs will need to be readded. You can copy and paste the links from the duplicate. If the merged FEC is for a new country that was not included on the master Person’s record, you will need to recreate the case. Access the information and refer to Foreign Engagement Case — Add, View, Edit and Close in Cúram (Action) and Foreign Benefit Application—Add, Access, Modify, and Delete in Cúram to recreate the case on the master Person’s profile. Note: Use the information on the duplicate record to create it. If the merged FEC is for a country that was already included on the master Person’s record, use the information in the duplicate FEC to update the master record’s FEC for that country. What you need to know When a Statement of Estimated Income after Retirement or Reduction in Pension Income Year 20XX (ISP-3041) form is received, you will use the Statement of Estimated Income wizard to create a new statement of estimated income evidence record based on the relevant details on the form. The wizard will guide you through adding the required information to create Estimated Income evidence and Estimated Income Data evidence. The information found in these 3 evidences are as follows: Table 1. Evidence types and information Evidence Information Statement of Estimated Income evidence This evidence captures the general information about the statement (e.g. estimate year, receipt date) and the event (e.g. event type, event date, reconciliation status). Only one Statement of Estimated Income evidence should exist for each estimate year. If a subsequent ISP-3041 form is received for the same estimate year, you must amend the existing statement for that year rather than create a new one. Estimated Income evidence This evidence captures the income types and frequencies of payments. A separate estimated income evidence is created for each income type. Estimated Income Data evidence This evidence captures the details of each income type (e.g. benefit rates before and after the event). A separate estimated income data evidence is created for each pension or income change in the estimate year. For example, if a client’s Registered Retirement Income Fund payments reduced twice during the estimate year, 3 estimated income data evidences are required: one for the start date and initial payment amount; and one for each payment rate reduction. Before activating the evidence in Cúram, you must review and analyze the information to ensure it is as complete and accurate as possible to avoid overpayments when the estimated income is reconciled with the actual income in the following year. For more information on analyzing the information provided on the ISP-3041, refer to Options (Scenario) . Once all updates have been applied and the evidences have been activated, Cúram will perform the option calculation based on the estimated income details that have been data captured. Cúram will use the estimated income evidences to calculate blocks 1, 2, 3, 7, 8 and 9. You must capture all income from these blocks as estimated income evidence, including non-optionable income (e.g. base calendar year) from Block 9. This income is automatically combined with the base calendar year income for blocks 4, 5 and 6 to determine the total estimated income. This total estimated income is compared to the total base year income and the most advantageous income is used to calculate entitlement for the income-tested benefit during the option period. Estimated income can be entered retroactively when the applicable base year income has been received. The statement of estimated income, estimated income and estimated income data evidences exist in both Integrated Cases and Application Cases. If an income-tested benefit is not approved, the evidences are maintained in the Application Case. If the benefit is approved, the evidences are maintained in the Integrated Case. Refer to Application Case, Integrated Case and Product Delivery Case in Cúram (Knowledge) . When the evidences are activated, even if they are not being used directly in the calculation (e.g. not to the client's advantage), the capture of this information allows the system to implement all downstream functions (e.g. creating tasks to trigger reconciliation and sending of options). Note: If a Total Payment Income override has been added to the account, ensure you review and edit the end date or delete it altogether if it affects the period covered by the estimate. Refer to Eligibility and Entitlement Override Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Reconciliation In some cases, Cúram will perform the option reconciliation automatically. If you are processing an "Estimated Income Reconciliation" task or you are processing an option and the actual income is available, you must manually reconcile the estimated and actual incomes and record the result in Cúram. For more information on option reconciliation, refer to KA-01448 Reconcile Options (Scenario) (article not available). To reflect the results of the manual reconciliation, update the Reconciled field by selecting: Not Applicable if at the time of processing the option, the actual income is not available for the estimate year to perform the reconciliation and : it is before renewal following the year of the estimate. It is not expected that the actual income would be received yet; or it is after renewal following the year of the estimate, but before October. It is expected that the actual income would be received. You must wait until the actual income is received to process the option and perform the reconciliation. Yes if the actual income has been received for the estimate year and you have successfully reconciled the estimated and actual incomes. This includes situations where the reconciled income is no longer to the client`s advantage. No if: it is October or later and the actual income should have been received but is not available, and the client has not responded to requests sent to submit the income information; or the actual income has been received for the estimate year but you were unable to reconcile discrepancies (e.g. the client did not respond to requests for clarification). Note: If you select No , the client’s estimated income for the affected payment period will not be used for the entitlement calculation. If the client was previously paid based on the estimated income, Cúram will recalculate the entitlement for the period of the option using the base calendar year income. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do When a new Statement of Estimated Income after Retirement or Reduction in Pension Income Year 20XX (ISP-3041) form is received for an estimate year, you must add a new Statement of Estimated Income evidence to capture the details of the event and income. This will create the applicable Estimated Income and Estimated Income Data evidences. If a subsequent form for the same year is received or if changes are needed once the Statement of Estimated Income evidence has been created for a given year, you must edit, add or delete the existing evidences as required. New Cúram and the Options Calculator will perform the option calculation based on the estimate details that have been data captured and activated. Therefore, when you receive a Statement of Estimated Income after Retirement or Reduction in Pension Income Year 20XX (ISP-3041) form, you must review and analyze the information provided to ensure it is complete, accurate and that the details of all the applicable events have been recorded. Refer to Options (Scenario) . Data capture the client’s estimated income details in the Options Calculator . Review the information in the Options Calculator to ensure the results are as you expected. Add the statement of estimated income evidence. Refer to the Add statement of estimated income evidence section below. Add the estimated income evidence. Refer to the Add estimated income evidence section below. Add the estimated income data evidence. Refer to the Add estimated income data evidence section below. Warning: If you are updating the evidence on the Integrated Case, do not activate until you compare the client’s estimated income to the Total individual Estimated Income amount calculated via the Options Calculator and determine the amounts match. You must leave the evidence in In-edit status or there is a risk of incorrect financials being generated. For new business applications, the evidence on the Application Case can be activated but the benefit cannot be authorized until you compare the client’s estimated income to the Total individual Estimated Income amount calculated via the Options Calculator and determine the amounts match. Compare the estimated amount from the Options Calculator to the individual estimated income amount calculated in Cúram. To view the estimated income in Cúram: Proceed according to the type of case you are working on: On an Application Case, go to Step b . On an Integrated Case, access the Product Delivery Case, then go to Step b . Click Check Eligibility in the top right-hand corner of the screen. Proceed according to the type of case you are working on: On an Application Case, click Yes . On an Integrated Case, ensure the Use Active Evidence Only box is unchecked and click Save . Click the Coverage Period that is expected to be calculated on the estimated income. Click the Income tab to view the estimated income. Determine if the amounts match. If yes, you must activate the evidence or authorize the Application Case. Refer to the Activate estimated income evidence section below. If no, you must enter an Individual Payment Income entitlement override for the total individual payment income calculated by the Options Calculator . Refer to Eligibility and Entitlement Override Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Enter the total option income. Enter the duration of the option (i.e. the period the income should be applied). Once the override is activated, you must activate the evidences or authorize the Application Case. When adding your note in ITRDS regarding the results of processing the option, ensure you include that an override was added in Cúram using the results from the Excel Options Calculator . Statement of estimated income evidence H2 Exp-coll: Add statement of estimated income evidence In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Determine where to add the statement of estimated income evidence: To add the evidence on an Application Case: Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the case in the Reference column. To add the evidence on an Integrated Case: Click Cases on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the Old Age Security case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab. Hover over Statement of Estimated Income in the Income section and click the plus ( + ) icon. The New Statement of Estimated Income wizard opens. Enter the following information in the New Statement of Estimated Income wizard: Note: If more than one event occurred for a particular income type (e.g. 2 pension reduction events occurred in the same estimate year), you can only enter the initial event in this wizard. Any additional events will be captured in the in the Estimated Income Data evidence later. The Reconciled field is only accessible in the Edit Statement of Estimated Income evidence that is created after the Statement of Estimated Income evidence is added. Form details Field Direction Participant Mandatory The client’s name is selected by default. Note: If the information is submitted by the spouse, select their name. Statement Receipt Date Mandatory Select the correct date from the calendar. Note: The Statement Receipt Date must be on or before the current date. This field must not be left blank. Year Mandatory Select the year of estimated income. Employment or Self Employment Field Direction Has Retired Mandatory Select Yes or No . Date of Retirement Select the retirement date from the calendar. Note: You must enter a Date of Retirement if you selected Yes in the Has Retired drop-down menu. Was Seasonal Employment Select Yes or No . Note: You must make a selection in the Was Seasonal Employment drop-down menu if Yes is selected from the Has Retired drop-down menu. Intends to Return to Employment Select Yes or No . Note: You must make a selection in the Intends to Return to Employment drop-down menu if you selected Yes in the Was Seasonal Employment drop-down menu. Date of Return Select the correct date from the calendar. Note: You must make a selection in the Date of Return calendar if you selected Yes in the Intends to Return to Employment drop-down menu. Canada Emergency Response Benefit Field Direction Canada Emergency Response Benefit Ceased Mandatory Select Yes or No . CERB End Date Select the first day of the month from the calendar that the client did not receive a payment. Note: You must make a selection in the CERB End Date calendar if you selected Yes in the Canada Emergency Response Benefit Ceased drop-down menu. Pension, EI and Worker's Compensation Field Direction Pension, EI or Worker’s Compensation Reduced and/or Ceased Mandatory Select Yes or No . Reduction or Cessation Date Select the first day of the month from the calendar that the client’s pension reduced or they did not receive a payment. For example: If the first reduced payment that the client received was March 26, 2025, enter March 1, 2025 as the event date. If the final payment that the client received was July 31, 2025, enter August 1, 2025 as the event date. Note: You must make a selection in the Reduction or Cessation Date calendar if you selected Yes in the Pension, EI or Worker's Compensation Reduced and/or Ceased drop-down menu. Click Next once all statement details have been entered to proceed to the Pensions window of the wizard. Enter the following information in the Pensions window of the wizard: Note: If there is more than one change to a pension income type in the estimate year, those details can be added to the Estimated Income Data evidence later. Pension Details Field Direction Income Type Enter the applicable pension income information for the following income types: CPP or QPP benefits Pension from previous employment Pension from other countries Alimony or maintenance payments Registered Retirement Income Fund (RRIF) Annuity from Registered Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP) Disability benefit from a private insurance plan Other pension or annuity Start Date Mandatory For each applicable income type, select the date that the client indicated the pension or income started from the calendar. Initial Amount Mandatory For each applicable income type, enter the amount of the income the client indicated they received in January of the estimated income year or the start date. Event Date Optional For each applicable income type, select the date that the pension or income amount changed or will change from the calendar. If there is no change to this income type for the year, leave this field blank. Final Amount Optional For each applicable income type, enter the amount of the income the client indicated that they received or will receive after the event date. If there is no change to this income type for the year, leave this field blank. Frequency Mandatory For each applicable income type, select one of the following from the Frequency drop-down menu: Weekly Every 2 weeks Monthly Quarterly Semi-annually Annually Lump Sum Click Save and Next once all pension income details have been entered, to proceed to the Benefits window of the wizard. Enter the following information in the Benefits window of the wizard: Note: If there is more than one change to a benefit income type in the estimate year, those details can be added to the Estimated Income Data evidence later. Benefits Details Field Direction Income Type Enter the applicable benefit income information for the following income types: Employment insurance Worker's compensation CERB ERB Start Date Mandatory For each applicable income type, select the date that the client indicated the benefit started from the calendar. Initial Amount Mandatory For each applicable income type, enter the amount of the income the client indicated they received in January of the estimated income year or the start date. Event Date Optional For each applicable income type, select the date that the benefit amount changed or will change from the calendar. If there is no change to this income type for the year, leave this field blank. Final Amount Optional For each applicable income type, enter the amount of the income the client indicated that they received or will receive after the event date. If there is no change to this income type for the year, leave this field blank. Frequency Mandatory For each applicable income type, select one of the following from the Frequency drop-down menu: Weekly Every 2 weeks Monthly Quarterly Semi-annually Annually Lump Sum Clique Save and Next once all benefit income information has been entered to proceed to the Earnings window of the wizard. Enter the following information in the Earnings window of the wizard: Note: If there is more than one change to an earnings income in the estimate year, those details can be added to the Estimated Income Data Evidence later. Earnings Details Field Direction Income Type Enter the applicable earnings income information for the following income types: Employment earnings Self-employment earnings Note: Cúram will apply the earnings exemption as applicable to employment and self-employment income. Refer to Earnings Exemption (Knowledge) . Severance pay Vacation pay Sick leave benefits Retroactive salary adjustments Salary bonuses Disposition of business assets Note : If the client received any of the above income types in the estimate year after retirement, enter them in the wizard. This income can be excluded in the Estimated Income Data evidence later if it is not to be included in the estimate calculation. Start Date Mandatory For each applicable income type, select the date that the client indicated the benefit started from the calendar. Initial Amount Mandatory For employment and self-employment income: If the client retired in the estimate year, enter the net amount of income they indicated they received from January up to the retirement date. If retirement is not the event or the retirement did not occur in the estimate year, enter the net amount of income the client indicated they received or expect to receive for the year. For all other income types selected, enter the lump sum amount received. Event Date Optional Select the retirement date from the calendar. If there is no change to this income type for the year, leave this field blank. Final Amount Optional For employment and self-employment income, enter the net amount of income the client indicated they received or expect to receive from the retirement date to the end of the year. If there is no change to this income type for the year, leave this field blank. Frequency Mandatory For each income type, select one of the following from the Frequency drop-down menu: Annually for employment or self-employment income; or Lump Sum for all other income types. Click Save and Next once all earnings income has been entered to proceed to the Other Income window of the assistant. Enter the following information in the Other Income window of the wizard: Note: If the client has Block 9 income in their base calendar year income, you must include it as other income. Cúram will not automatically apply this amount to the estimated income (e.g. RRSP income received in 2023 required to calculate a C4 option effective August 2024). Other Income Details Field Direction Block 9 Base Income applicable to events from 20XX-01-01 through 20XX-06-30 Optional Enter the total amount of Block 9 base calendar year income that must be added to the estimated income for this payment period. Block 9 Base Income applicable to events from 20XX-07-01 through 20XX-06-30 Optional Enter the total amount of Block 9 base calendar year income that must be added to the estimated income for this payment period. Click Submit once all other income has been entered to complete the data capture in the Statement of Estimated Income evidence wizard. Do not modify or delete.)</content></document><document><reference>https://kmt-ogc.service.gc.ca/en/knowledgebase/article-latest?pid=KA-05426&amp;cid=CAT-02016</reference><title>Search  for a Person in Cúram (Action)</title><video_link>['https://014gc.sharepoint.com/sites/95530/_layouts/15/stream.aspx?id=%2Fsites%2F95530%2FHowto%20Clips%2FHow%2Dto%20Clips%2FProcessing%2FProcessors%2FManaging%20Person%20Profiles%2FSearch%20for%20a%20Person%20or%20Prospect%20Person%2Emp4&amp;referrer=StreamWebApp%2EWeb&amp;referrerScenario=AddressBarCopied%2Eview%2E80b2d384%2D3522%2D4539%2Da91b%2D81829df37d4b', 'https://014gc.sharepoint.com/sites/95530/Howto%20Clips/How-to%20Clips/Processing/Processors/Managing%20Person%20Profiles/Search%20for%20a%20Person%20or%20Prospect%20Person.mp4']</video_link><video_name>['Search for a Person and View Information', 'Search for a Person or Prospect Person']</video_name><walkme_flow_id>[-1]</walkme_flow_id><walkme_flow_name>['placeholder']</walkme_flow_name><content>Overview Summary This procedure provides you with steps to search for a Person or Prospect Person using different criteria in Cúram. What you need to know There are several situations when you can search for a Person or Prospect Person, such as: searching for a Person for specific evidence; adding evidence to the Person's records; and verifying if a Person already exists in Cúram before creating a new profile. To perform an effective Person or Prospect Person search, you must enter one of the following criteria that contain at least 2 or more characters: Updated Reference Number (e.g. SIN, OAS account number, Cúram reference number, Client identification number, foreign identification number, International Agreement number (e.g. 000111222)) Note: It is possible that one reference number will produce more than one search result (e.g. a 9-digit SIN matches a 9-digit Cúram reference number). You must verify the client’s name before selecting an account from the search results. If a search for a client in Cúram using their SIN is unsuccessful, you must also search using their first name, last name and one of the search criteria to prevent creating a duplicate profile. Correspondence Tracking Number (Cúram generated number assigned to a specific correspondence) Either First Name , Last Name or both, and at least one of the following search criteria: Date of Birth Province , Territory , State or Region Country Postal or ZIP Code Country Code , Area Code and Phone Number Note: If you search using any names with accents or special characters (e.g. hyphens, apostrophes, periods, and spaces), the search results will only display the regular letters without the accents or special characters in Cúram. If the correct spelling of the first and/or last names is unknown, you can place a % as a placeholder for unknown character (e.g. "Smith" can be "%mith", "S%th", and "Smi%"). Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Search by Reference Number using Smart Search It is easier to search for a person using a reference number, if it is available. In Cúram, click Smart Search in the top banner of the home page. The Smart Search field will say “Enter Reference Number or Keyword” and have a magnifying glass icon to the right. Enter the reference number. The applicable result will display under the Smart Search bar automatically. Click the result to open the Person's record in a new tab. H2 Exp-coll: Search for a person or prospect person using the Search Criteria section Updated In Cúram, click Cases and Outcomes . Click the Shortcuts panel on the left side of the screen. Under Searches , click Person Search… . The Person Search screen opens in a new tab. Enter the information in the Search Criteria section as follows: Table 1—Fields and Directions in the Search Criteria Section Field Direction Reference Number Enter a reference number, including the SIN, OAS account number, Cúram reference number, Client identification number, foreign identification number, and International Agreement number. Note: Click Search immediately after entering a reference number. Correspondence Tracking Number Enter the tracking number of the correspondence, if known. Note: Click Search immediately after entering a correspondence tracking number. Click Search . Verify if there are any records listed under Search Results and choose one of the following actions: If you need to add a Foreign Engagement Case manually, refer to Foreign Engagement Case—Add, View, Edit and Close in Cúram (Action) . If you need to add a new GIS and OAS application form, refer to Add an OAS and GIS Application Form in Cúram (Action) . If you need to add a new ALW / ALWS benefit application form, refer to Add an ALW or ALWS Application Form in Cúram (Action) . If you notice 2 or more person records and suspect a duplicate, you should raise the issue by creating a manual task. Refer to Manage Tasks in Cúram (Action) . New Note: If a search for a client in Cúram using their SIN is unsuccessful, you must also search using their first name, last name and date of birth to prevent creating a duplicate profile. H2 Exp-coll: Search for a person or a prospect person using Additional Search Criteria section In Cúram, click Cases and Outcomes . Click the Shortcuts panel on the left side of the screen. Under Registration , click Person... . The Register Person wizard opens. Enter the information in the Additional Search Criteria section as follows: Note: You must enter the information in the First Name field, the Last Name field, or both fields, and include at least one of the following search criteria: Date of Birth Province , Territory , State or Region Country Postal or ZIP Code Country Code , Area Code and Phone Number Table 2—Fields and Directions in the Additional Search Criteria Section Field Direction First Name Mandatory Enter the first name. Note: It is acceptable to fill out only one field between First Name and Last Name if an additional search criterion is used. Last Name Mandatory Enter the last name. Note: It is acceptable to fill out only one field between First Name and Last Name if an additional search criterion is used. Phonetic Search Check the Phonetic Search box to search for Persons by how their names sound. This search feature only works for last names. Date of Birth Enter the date of birth (YYYY-MM-DD), if known. You can click the Calendar icon and select the date or enter it manually. Gender Leave this field blank when searching for a Person. Last Name at Birth Enter the last name at birth, if known. This is only required if the Person's last name at birth is different from the current last name. Unit/Apt/Suite Number or Address Line 1 Enter the number of the unit or apartment, or the first line of the address, if known. Civic Number or Address Line 2 Enter the street number or the second line of the address, if known. Street Name or Address Line 3 Enter the street name or the third line of the address, if known. City, Town or Village or Address Line 4 Enter the city, town, village or the fourth line of the address, if known. Province, Territory, State or Region Enter the province, state, territory or region, if known. Note: The name of the province has to be spelled out. Postal or ZIP Code Enter the Postal or ZIP Codes, if known. Country Enter the country, if known. Country Code Select the country code of the phone number, if known. Area Code Enter the area code of the phone number, if known. Phone Number Enter the rest of the phone number, if known. Click Search . Verify if there are any records listed under Search Results and choose one of the following actions: Note: If no existing record is found and the date of birth was used in the search, search again using the 15th day of the month of birth to determine if a record already exists before continuing with the registration. Client profiles that migrated from the IA system and OAS Online to Cúram have a defaulted date of birth of the 15th of the month. If there is no existing person record, refer to Register a Person in Cúram (Action) . If there is a Person record under Search Results, click the hyperlink under the Reference Number column to go to the Person's profile. If you need to add a new ALW / ALWS benefit application form, refer to Add an ALW or ALWS Application Form in Cúram (Action) . What you need to know Before registering a client as a person, you must search and verify if the client already exists in Cúram. To do an effective person search, refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . If the client does not have an account in Cúram as a person, you must create a person record in Cúram before taking action on their account. The process of creating a person record in Cúram is called registration. If applicable, after you finish the registration process, you can enter the client's International Agreement number as an Identification Evidence. Refer to the Add a person's Identification section in the What you need to do section of the Step by Step tab in Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) and select IA Account Number as the Type . The mandatory information required to register a person in Cúram includes: first and last names; gender; date of birth; preferred languages in oral and written communication; and residential and mailing addresses. In Cúram, some person-level evidence types require verification, such as SIN, names, date of birth and so on. If there is a SIN in a person's profile, Cúram will automatically perform verification via Social Insurance Register (SIR). If the SIN does not match the SIR, Cúram will create a task to request verification of the SIN. If there is no SIN in a person's profile, Cúram will create a task to request validation on name or date of birth. Cúram will automatically activate the following evidence without verification upon registration: Address Gender Contact Preferences Telephone Number Cúram Reference Number If you have a reference number or a correspondence tracking number, go to the Search for a Person using the Search Criteria section in the What you need to do section under the Step by Step tab. Otherwise, go to the Search for a Person using Additional Search Criteria section in the What you need to do section under the Step by Step tab. What you need to know The CRA birth and death details evidence in Cúram records a client's date of birth and date of death as reported by the CRA. You can access CRA birth and death details evidence under the Evidence tab at the person level. Through system interfaces, Cúram receives information from the CRA systems to update the CRA birth and death details automatically. If the person's profile does not have any CRA birth and death details evidence, Cúram will create the evidence automatically based on the information provided by the CRA. If Cúram receives updated information from the CRA and the details do not match with the existing CRA birth and death details evidence in the person's profile, Cúram will update the CRA birth and death details evidence with the new details from the CRA. Note: The CRA information it is not modifiable. It is added by the interface, and you cannot add, edit or delete it. If you determine that the CRA information is incorrect, you can document it in a case note. A task is created to process the death match file from CRA and address the discrepancy between CRA birth and death details evidence and the Department's birth and death details evidence. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do View the CRA birth and death details In Cúram, go to the person's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Evidence tab. What you need to know The CRA lifetime list evidence records information about a client's lifetime status based on the information provided on the applicant OAS income tested benefits applications. The GIS , ALW , ALWS and OAS pension application should not be included in the evidence records. This is important as the combined OAS pension and the GIS or the ALW or ALWS benefit application case is being created even when the client indicates no to GIS . Note: This is available also when using the XXX/Canada Agreement - Application for Canadian Old Age, Retirement and Survivors Benefits (SC ISP-5054-XXX) form. This evidence records new information for any changes in the client's CRA reported lifetime list status for the request made from the client's case. You can view the status of CRA lifetime list evidence under the Evidence tab in the client's profile. A manual request to add or delete a client to the CRA lifetime list is only required when Cúram does not automatically add or delete the client from the CRA lifetime list. This happens when the CRA is not responding to the verification request (e.g. response is delayed, the website is down). A manual request is also required when a client and/or spouse/common-law partner applied for the OAS pension and the GIS or the ALW or ALWS benefit and the spouse's/common-law partner's signature is not on file. Note: Cúram will send the CRA request based on the application case. Cúram will also send a request to add the spouse to the CRA lifetime list when the spouse or common-law signature is on file. The New CRA Request wizard opens. Select the participant in the Participant drop-down menu. Select Add to CRA Lifetime List from the drop-down list under Request Type . Select the Tax year . Note: You can select all the available years, if needed. Click Save . Cúram will create the new CRA lifetime list evidence on the client's evidence with a status of Added . Note: When you submit a request for CRA Income for the first time, Cúram simultaneously initiates the Add to CRA lifetime list process. If the process is successful, Cúram will start recording the data received from the CRA. What you need to know Non-resident clients receiving OAS payments, who live in a country that the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) requires an OAS return of income form from must file the form each year. In June of every year, the CRA provides information to Cúram about clients who have not filed their OAS return of income for the preceding year (i.e. the current tax year).If Cúram is unable to create OAS return of income evidence, staff from the Department will manually create and modify the OAS return of income non-filer evidence. Note: Non-resident clients receiving OAS payments must file an OAS return of income. OAS return of income non-filer evidence is created when: a client has not filed their OAS return of income for the current tax year before the end of June. In this case, their benefit is suspended. Refer to Add OAS Return of Income non-filer evidence section in the What you need to do section of the Step by Step tab ; or a client has filed their OAS return of income for a previous tax year or has filed their OAS return of income after the deadline for the current tax year. In this case, the OAS return of income non-filer evidence must be updated. Once the client's filer status is updated, their benefit is reinstated and/or their payments are released for the tax year that they have filed for. Refer to Edit OAS Return of Income non-filer evidence section in the What you need to do section of the Step by Step tab . Note: The "non-filer" status reinstatement only affects the tax year for which the client has an outstanding OAS return of income. The tax year for retroactive payments is from July to June. The evidence exists in both Application Cases and Integrated Cases. If the OAS benefit is not approved, the non-filer evidence is maintained in the Application Case. If the benefit is authorized, the non-filer evidence is maintained in the Integrated Case. What you need to know The Application Details evidence in Cúram represents a client's request for a specific benefit type, the dates that would affect that benefit's start date, and the ongoing status of the application (found on the application case summary) for a benefit.. This evidence can be found at the Application Case and Integrated Case level. Application Details is the header record for the application life cycle evidence;it is the evidence that governs the lifecycle of a client's application for an OAS pension or benefit in Cúram.  This evidence is generated by Cúram when an application for any OAS benefit is submitted by a client through the Client Portal, or by an agent. It cannot be created or deleted by a user. The evidence's tab is the primary workspace for managing all OAS pension or benefit associated evidence. Migrated Data Consideration: A full review of the migrated case will be required each time any evidence is being managed on any migrated cases. And also in the following scenarios If the ISP-1800 is processed on a migrated case, If the Start Date on Migrated case is updated Withdrawal: A client can withdraw an application for the OAS pension at any point before the first payment is issued. The Application Details evidence is used to manage the process of withdrawal of an OAS pension from a pending Application Case or an open Integrated Case. If an Application Details evidence had a Withdrawn status, the OAS pension or benefit associated with that case is automatically updated to Withdrawn / Opt out . When the Withdrawn status is selected, the following mandatory fields are populated: Date - same as the Application Details evidence Withdrawal Date field. Requested By - is the Participant associated with the Application Details evidence. Withdrawal Method - select from Paper or Online . Withdrawal Reason - select to Change of Circumstances . Opt Out: When Opt Out status is selected, the following mandatory fields are populated: Date - same as the Application Details evidence Withdrawal Date field. Requested By - is the Participant associated with the Application Details evidence. Withdrawal Method - select from Paper or Online . Withdrawal Reason - select to Opt out of Auto enrolment . Note: If the only benefit associated with the Application Case is an OAS pension, the withdrawal request process will set the case status to Closed by the system. Deemed Date, Benefit Cancelation Request and Benefit Cessation evidences Deemed Date , Benefit Cancelation Request and Benefit Cessation are evidences that are linked to the Application Details. The evidence is specific to the application that are linked to. These can be created under the Application Details. Note: If the Application Details evidence has Active or In-Edit evidences of the associated evidence type, the evidence items will be displayed and active. Deemed Date evidence can be used to record multiple deemed application dates for a given Application Details record. ISP-1800 Disability application uses the Deemed Date It can replace the Application Details Receipt Date . Benefit Cancellation Request is used to capture a client's request to cancel an OAS pension or GIS represented by a specific Application Details record. Benefit Cessation is used to capture a client's request to cease an OAS pension or benefit that is in pay and represented by a specific Application Details record. Note: The cessation or cancelation of an OAS pension will cause any related GIS or ALW benefits to also cease. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: View application details In Cúram, go to the person's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Application tab. Click Cases on the page group navigation bar on the left. The list of client's cases will display. What you need to know A client can request to stop receiving an OAS pension or benefit that is in pay by submitting a cessation request if it has been more than 6 months from the date the first payment was issued. If there are less than 6 months from the date the first payment was issued, a cancellation request is required. If a request is received late, you must still input the date received. The payments will only stop the next accounting month. The client can reinstate a ceased OAS pension via a written request. The receipt date of a written request is the effective date, and no retroactivity is paid. The GIS and the ALW and ALWS benefits cannot be reinstated without a new application. What you need to know Foreign income evidence captures information about a client's income from foreign sources as reported by the client. The evidence is only used to gather and track foreign income and is not used in entitlement calculations. If foreign income is received that needs to be counted toward a client's entitlement determination, the amount is entered into Manually Reported Income. The foreign income evidence Amount field is meant to gather the raw data as submitted by the client, meaning this should reflect the appropriate numeric value for the currency of the income. Manual conversion to Canadian Dollars would be completed before entering that amount in manually reported income evidence to be used in entitlement calculation. Refer to Manually Entered Income Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Note: Foreign pension income information is collected from the application which results in the automatic creation of the foreign pension income evidence upon submission. It will not automatically update Manually Reported Income. Agents must check and confirm this information provided by the client, verify this information, and update the evidence accordingly before authorizing an application. Multiple instances of foreign income evidence may be necessary to ensure all the details are accurately recorded. The evidence exists in both Integrated Cases and Application Cases. If the benefit is not approved, the foreign income evidence is maintained in the Application Case. If the benefit is approved, the foreign income evidence is maintained in the Integrated Case. Refer to Application Case, Integrated Case and Product Delivery Case in Cùram (Knowledge) . What you need to know World income evidence captures whether a client's total world income is above the annual threshold for the OAS Recovery Tax. World income information is captured in the application form when a client applies for OAS. When a client indicates that their income is over the allowable threshold, or they do not answer the question on their application, this should be captured in the evidence record. The evidence record specifies the tax year and associated income threshold, and whether the client is above or below the threshold. Note: Not Applicable should be selected from the Over Threshold drop-down menu if the client is a resident of Canada for tax purposes or if they reside in a country that has a tax treaty with Canada in force. The evidence exists in both Integrated Cases and Application Cases. If the benefit is not approved, the world income evidence is maintained in the Application Case. If the benefit is approved, the world income evidence is maintained in the Integrated Case. Refer to Application Case, Integrated Case and Product Delivery Case in Cúram (Knowledge) . Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Add world income evidence In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Determine where to add the world income evidence: To add the evidence on an Application Case: Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the case in the Reference column. To add the evidence on Integrated Case: Click Cases on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the Old Age Security case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab. Hover over World Income Evidence and click the plus ( + ) icon. The New World Income Evidence window opens. Enter the following details in the World Income evidence section: Table 1—Field and Direction under World Income Evidence Section Field Direction Date Received Review the Date Received . If the date is correct, leave the field as is. If the date is incorrect, select the correct date from the calendar. Participant The client's name is selected by default. What you need to know A benefit suspension evidence is used to temporarily pause payments of a benefit on the Integrated Case Evidence. The evidence allows the suspension of individual benefits or all benefits. A suspension may be completely lifted or partially lifted. Note: Deleting a suspension will unsuspend the benefit. This should only be done if the evidence was incorrectly put on the client's case. You cannot initiate a retroactive suspension as it is simply stopping the entitlement from going out. Retroactively, it is already gone. To suspend moving forward - add suspension evidence with a Suspension Status of Suspended . To Unsuspend moving forward but leave the period (from the suspension start date) suspended - add an end date to the evidence. To unsuspend and release all entitlements previously blocked - change the Suspension status to Unsuspended . Note: The suspend and unsuspend actions are done manually. A benefit suspension evidence will cause the current determination to display entitlement amount to be $0.00, suspension reason being lack of entitlement. Note: A benefit suspension cannot be applied for any period in which a payment has already been issued. When unsuspending a benefit, you must determine if the client is underpaid or overpaid. This will be transmitted in the notification letter that is manually sent out. When unsuspending all benefits in the integrated case or suspending a specific benefit, you must apply changes to both benefits at the same time, regardless of which benefits are involved. This is necessary to stop a payment from accidentally being issued on the benefit you would want to remain suspended.
