What you need to know Manually entered income evidence records different income types used for calculating a client's GIS , ALW or ALWS benefit amount. It is used to report a client's income during a specific base calendar year attached to a payment period. For example, the manually entered income for the year 2021 applies to the payment period from July 1, 2022, to June 30, 2023. The evidence exists in both Integrated Cases and Application Cases. If the benefit is not authorized, the manually entered status evidence is maintained in the Application Case. If the benefit is authorized, the manually entered income evidence is maintained in the Integrated Case. Refer to Application Case, Integrated Case and Product Delivery Case in Cúram (Knowledge) . Note: When manually entering income evidence, Income Deductions are to be calculated ahead of time by the client (as per page 2 of the Statement of Income for the Guaranteed Income Supplement, the Allowance or Allowance for the Survivor for payment period of July (20XX) to June (20XX) with Information Sheet (ISP-3026) form) which means that individual deductions are not captured by Cúram nor would a user do it. Example: the deduction amounts of Block 30800, 22215, and 31200 are entered in the single Net employment income (Block 7), therefore is no way for Cúram to know that this is information was entered and therefore would not be removed afterwards. When manually entering Earnings Exemptions, these are calculated after submitting the manual income evidence. The evidence will always reflect the pre-exemption amount, whereas the income tab of the display rules will reflect the post-exemption amount, which is why Block 7 and Block 8 may be different in the evidence than in the display rules. Cúram will automatically apply the Employment Earnings Exception to client’s income. It is critical that net reported incomes are correctly entered so that Cúram can accurately calculate Earning Exemptions. Cúram will track the client’s retroactive period of date protection when you encode the received date of the manual income evidence. What you need to know Legal status evidence captures a client's Canadian legal status. A client may have multiple legal status evidence entries. These entries can contain multiple legal status if there is a change in a client's legal status information. Evidence is listed in descending order from the most recent status. The evidence exists in both Application Cases and Integrated Cases. If the benefit is not approved, the legal status evidence is maintained in the Application Case. If the benefit is approved, the legal status evidence is maintained in the Integrated Case. When the legal status is maintained in the Application Case, adding and editing the evidence require verification. Deleting the legal status in an Application Case does not require any verification or activation. When the legal status evidence is maintained in an Integrated Case, adding and editing the evidence requires verification and activation. Deleting the evidence only requires activation. Refer to Application Case, Integrated Case and Product Delivery Case in Cùram (Knowledge) . What you need to know A manual payment is made outside of Cúram when the system cannot issue a payment for a client, and an immediate payment is required. If the Department issues a payment manually to the client outside of Cúram, the record of the manual payment must be recorded in Cúram through the Manual Payment wizard under the Financials tab at the person level. Once recorded, Cúram compares the gross amount of the manual payment with the system calculated entitlement amount for the coverage period. If a discrepancy exists, Cúram automatically generates an overpayment or underpayment. When deductions exist on the manual payment, Cúram will automatically update the applicable deduction record to reflect the amount withheld from the payment. Not all payments issued outside of Cúram need to be recorded. There will be some exceptions (e.g. refunding deductions to clients). When a client requests a retroactive payment be issued immediately, you can issue the priority payment through the Issue Retro Pending Payments function in the product delivery case. OAS Gross Amount Enter the dollar amount for OAS gross amount. ALW Gross Amount Enter the dollar amount for ALW gross amount. GIS Gross Amount Enter the dollar amount for GIS gross amount. ALWS Gross Amount Enter the dollar amount for ALWS gross amount. Deduction Type Check one or multiple boxes in front of the applicable deduction types. Net Amount Mandatory Enter the dollar amount for the net amount. Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Next to move to the 4 Record Deduction tab. Click Save when there are no deductions. Enter the dollar amount in the Deduction Amount field. Note: When multiple deductions exist, enter the dollar amount for each deduction type. Click Save . H2 Exp-coll: Issue retro pending payments In Cúram, go to client's profile. What you need to know Current and previous year-to-date information for a client is accessed under the Financials tab of the Person record, on the Tax Slips page. The page displays the total amount of old age benefits paid to clients within the current year, sorted into Benefit Types (OAS, GIS , ALW and ALWS ). It also shows all deductions made from these payments, categorized by type. This helps in understanding the net amount received by clients after all deductions. A record is retained for each tax year in which the client receives old age benefits. The data reflects the current information, and the year-to-date totals are updated when you access the page. The following table provides descriptions of the information shown on the Year to Date windows: Table 1—Description of Information Shown in the Current and Previous Year to Date Window Section Description Benefit Issued The Benefit Type column shows the total amounts paid to the client by type (OAS, GIS , ALW and ALWS ). The Domestic column shows the gross benefit amount paid while the client was resident in Canada for the given benefit type. The Foreign column shows the foreign gross benefit amount paid while the client was living abroad for the given benefit type. The Totals column shows the sum of domestic and foreign benefits. There is also a Gross Entitlement Benefit Type row that shows the sum totals of Domestic , Foreign and Totals columns for all benefits paid to the client. Tax Slip Deductions The Tax Slip Deductions section shows the total deduction amounts withheld from domestic and foreign benefit payments for deduction types included in tax slips. Deductions amounts are grouped by Deduction Type and issuance location ( Domestic or Foreign ). The Deduction Type column shows the type of deduction. Deduction types include: Overpayment – OAS Pension Overpayment – GIS Overpayment – ALW Overpayment – ALWS Federal VTW Provincial VTW Non-resident Tax OAS Recovery Tax The Domestic column shows the domestic deduction amount for the given deduction type. The Foreign column shows the foreign deduction amount for the given deduction type. The Totals column shows the sum of domestic and foreign benefits. The Total Deductions row shows sum totals of the Domestic , Foreign and Totals columns. Note: If the Domestic and Foreign gross benefit amounts are $0.00, only the Total Deductions row is displayed. Non Tax Slip Deductions The Non Tax Slip Deductions section shows the total deductions withheld from domestic and foreign benefit payments for deduction types excluded from tax slips. Deductions amounts are grouped by Deduction Type and issuance location ( Domestic or Foreign ). The Deduction Type column shows the type of deduction. Deduction types include: Interest Penalties Canada Pension Plan Employment Insurance CRA Set Off Veterans Affairs Canada SAA Reimbursement DOJ Arrears DOJ Fees Interest Non-Debtor Penalty Non-Debtor Overpayment Non-Debtor The Domestic column shows the domestic deduction amount for the given deduction type. The Foreign column shows the foreign deduction amount for the given deduction type. The Totals column shows the sum of domestic and foreign benefits. The Total Deductions row shows sum totals of the Domestic , Foreign and Totals columns. The Net Payment row shows the net amount issued to the client for domestic and foreign benefit payments after all deductions are made. Note: If the Domestic and Foreign gross benefit amounts are $0.00, only the Total Deductions row is displayed. Click Tax Slips in the page group navigation bar on the left. The Tax Slips page opens. Click Current YTD or Previous YTD to view year-to-date information for the current year or the previous year. What you need to know H2 Exp-coll: Write-offs Updated New There are 2 different types of write-offs: write-offs under the Financial Administration Act ; and write-offs in Cúram. New A write-off under the Financial Administration Act is the removal of an overpayment, in whole or in part, from the accounts receivable records. Depending on the write-off reason, it may be a permanent or temporary forgiveness of the debt. For more information, refer to Write-Off an Overpayment (Scenario) . Updated However, a write-off in Cúram is an adjustment that reduces the initial liability amount of a debt. It is not an actual forgiveness of the debt, and it could be recovered at some point in the future. H2 Exp-coll: Remissions Updated Updated A remission is the decision to forgive an otherwise legally enforceable debt and is managed through the write-off functionality in Cúram. Remissions should only be used when it is determined that none of the liability will be recovered in the future. Updated Note: Recommendations for full remissions must be requested directly in the Public Sector Collections and Disbursements system. You must submit a CFOB F&amp;A Portal External link request for partial remissions only. You should never input a remission or write-off under the Financial Administration Act directly in Cúram unless there is an interface failure and you are directed to do so by the Chief Financial Officer Branch. H2 Exp-coll: Reversals of write-offs or remissions Reversals of remissions or write-offs under the Financial Administration Act are only done in Cúram in exceptional cases when the Public Sector Collections and Disbursements system interface is unable to transmit or receive data. When you reverse a write-off or remission, the initial liability amount or outstanding debt balance is increased by the amount of the reversal in the Person record. As a result, the debt becomes collectible again. The write-off may or may not be able to be reversed in the future depending on the write-off reason. For example, a compromise settlement or a discharged bankruptcy cannot be reversed. H2 Exp-coll: Write-off reason codes New Note: When a cancellation request is submitted, Cúram calculates any resulting overpayments based on the gross amount paid. To ensure accurate recovery, the appropriate write-off reason codes must be applied in Cúram to adjust the amounts accordingly. The following write-off reason codes are available in Cúram: Table 1. Write-off reason codes and description Write-off reason code Description Cancelled Legacy Payment This code is used in situations when updated evidence created an overpayment based on previously migrated data, and a cancelled legacy payment exists for the same period; the amount of the cancelled legacy payment can then be applied towards the client's debt. This will trigger a debt adjustment in the Public Sector Collections and Disbursements (PSCD) system making it possible to collect the actual recoverable amount. Benefit Cancellation Deductions This code is used to write-off a portion of the overpayment when there are deductions (e.g. voluntary tax, OAS recovery tax) associated with a benefit cancellation. This ensures that the overpayment balance in PSCD accurately reflects the client’s actual liability that should be recovered. When a client does not repay all amounts received within the prescribed timeframe and the benefit cancellation request cannot be approved, you will reverse the write-off and a corresponding Benefit Cancellation Deductions reversal reason is created. Reconciliation – RD This code is used when a client receives a payment that includes a reversible deduction (e.g. non-resident tax, federal voluntary tax, OAS recovery tax deducted in the current year), and a subsequent reassessment for that period results in an entitlement of $0. In these cases, you must manually reverse the deduction and use this write-off reason to reduce the total overpayment amount for the client. For more information, refer to Manual Reversal of Deduction in Cúram (Action) . This will ensure that PSCD will have the correct overpayment amount, if any, resulting from the reconciliation of reversible deductions and ensures corporate accounting will have the correct information to adjust their interdepartmental settlements for the month and year. This write-off reason is reversible in Cúram. If a debt adjustment is reversed, the trigger will automatically increase the liability in PSCD. Reconciliation – NRD This code is used to write-off non-reversible deduction overpayments that were created as part of the payment cancellation process. This code is not tracked by PSCD, but it is tracked by corporate accounting for balancing departmental funds. Non-reversible deductions include: department of justice arrears and fees; provincial voluntary tax withholds; CRA set-off; and taxes deducted in the previous year (non-resident tax, federal voluntary tax and OAS recovery tax). Other This code is used to partially or fully write-off an overpayment amount when the other codes do not fit the situation or when directed to through enquiries or guidance. An event is triggered for the PSCD to reduce the liability amount. The write-off can be reversed, which will increase the liability amount in PSCD. PSCD Processed Date Updated Enter the date the write-off was processed in PSCD. Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . Click on the Refresh icon on the right tab actions menu. A Liability Write Off type transaction will appear under the Transactions window. What you need to know An OAS / GIS Application Case is automatically created once an OAS and GIS application form is added in Cúram. Refer to Add an OAS and GIS Application Form in Cúram (Action) . An OAS / GIS Application Case can be accessed from the person's profile. You can view the OAS / GIS application for more information associated with a client's Application before starting the authorizing process. New If a client's OAS application was approved before the cutover (i.e. before March 1, 2025) but their GIS application was not, you must submit a standalone “Application for Guaranteed Income Supplement” to authorize the GIS . However, if you submit a new “Application for Old Age Security Pension and Guaranteed Income Supplement” instead, you must proceed with completing all necessary case work in the Application Case, including adding evidences, completing verifications, and resolving any outstanding tasks. The OAS benefit should then be authorized. Cúram will copy the relevant evidence to the migrated Integrated Case. You must then review the Integrated Case to ensure all evidence has been carried over to the Integrated Case and determine whether any overrides need to the updated or removed based on the information available. You can now authorize the GIS . New Note: Authorizing the OAS pension will not generate a duplicate benefit, as Cúram maintains only one Integrated Case and one Product Delivery Case. Note: The OAS/ GIS Application Case initial status is Open , or Awaiting Resolution . After you click Approve or Close the OAS/ GIS Application, the status is changed to Closed . Note: If Close is selected, the Application Case status becomes Closed . In this situation, an Integrated Case is not created. You must manually create a correspondence letter to inform the client of the decision. Refer to Correspondence—Create, Update, and Check Status in Cúram (Action) . After the OAS pension has been authorized, the Benefits page refreshes automatically and updates the status of the Benefit from Pending to Approved , and Completed On date is populated. The application case status is changed to Closed. Before authorizing your application case you can click Check Eligibility, Cúram runs eligibility checks and updates the eligibility decision on the eligibility check screen. You can view the details of the unmet criteria (e.g. residency, age) on the potential eligibility screen. If any evidence is missing or requires verification, you must manually send the correspondence associated with the tasks based on the information required to process the application. Once all the verifications and issues or flags have been resolved, an application can be authorized. When you select Authorize , a potential eligibility check record is created on the application case. Note: All open tasks other than the Application Case task must be closed before authorization. Failure to close tasks may potentially prevent the authorization of the Application Case. Viewing details of decisions The following screens can be used to view details of decisions for each criterion: Approved: Approval tab on Benefit line item can be expanded to view the criteria assessed. Closure: Closure tab on Benefit line item can be expanded to view the criteria assessed. Evidence: If an evidence issue exists, you can navigate to the evidence issue screen and view all the evidence which have an issue. Each individual evidence can be accessed to learn more about the issues. All client registered: If this criterion is not met, the user can check all the applicants on the application case to confirm which user is not registered. Identity confirmed: If this criterion is not met, the user can validate if there is outstanding verification on Name and SIN evidence. If there is a duplicate application during the authorization, the user will have to close one of them before authorizing the other. If the client is already receiving benefits, you will need to manually close the duplicate application. After the benefit has been authorized, the Old Age Security Integrated Case and Product Delivery Case are created. The Integrated Case will also be used for the GIS . If the client already has an Integrated Case or a Product Delivery Case, the cases will be updated with any new evidence information. Clients can receive OAS and GIS benefits together. However, they cannot receive ALW / ALWS Benefits along with OAS/ GIS . In some cases, an application may be added in Cúram and later denied. You must deny these applications in Cúram and the associated task should be closed. You can manually reopen a closed or withdrawn OAS or GIS benefit on the OAS GIS combined application case. This is possible when an Administrative Error , Appeal Decision , Request for Reconsideration, and/or a Response Received from SSA Country reopening reasons are met. Spouse and Non-Pensioner Spouse Non-Pensioner spouses are required to be registered as a Person to authorize GIS Benefit. Relevant tasks must be resolved. If there is a non-pensioner spouse on the application case, the benefit still needs to be authorized to close the application case. However, since the spouse is a non-pensioner, they will not be eligible for GIS . When an application is submitted with a spouse, you will need to deny their GIS benefit. If a spouse’s address differs from the primary applicant’s address, the provided address must be reviewed to ensure it matches the one listed on the application. In cases where the system has not automatically updated the spouse’s address, a manual update must be performed to reflect the correct address. GIS When a client qualifies for GIS , a single Old Age Security Benefit case is created and maintained to handle renewals on an annual basis. If the income is missing, it can be manually added. Active Application Details evidence with GIS must exist for the client before performing an override. If there are two applicants on a GIS application, both applicants must have Application Details evidence recorded. Failure to capture Application Details for both applicants will prevent the system from proceeding with GIS authorization. Marital Relationship The full period of the marital relationship must be provided to determine entitlement for income tested benefits. When a spouse’s date of death is added, the application case is automatically updated with this information, along with the marital status. If there is period of entitlement when the spouse was alive then you will add the spouse and their income to the application case. It is still possible to confirm a client’s marital status without requiring a date of marriage. You can contact the client to obtain the start date of the marriage. Ideally, the start date of the marriage should align with the start date of the benefit. If the marriage start date is provided within the same month as the benefit effective date, the benefit calculation can include the marital status from the benefit start date. When a person’s marital status is not aligned with the system’s record, Cúram will prevent the application from being processed. Marital status at the Person level cannot be updated directly. Instead, users must navigate to the application case and update the marital relationship evidence. Once the marital relationship evidence is activated, the marital status at the Person level will automatically update. Eligibility and Future Effective Date An application may have a future effective date, which can be found on the Client’s Application Case or their Integrated Case. The future effective date is located within the Application Details evidence under the Evidence tab. If all required criteria are met, a benefit can be authorized with a future effective date. On the eligibility check records, the user can view a detailed summary of all the criteria assessed to determine eligibility. Ensure correct application date is entered to ensure eligibility is properly calculated. The initial period of eligibility is determined based on the date of application, not the processing date. Eligibility for benefits is assessed from when the application was submitted. For Clients where earliest date of eligibility is more than 11 months after the application receipt date (For example, a 63-year-old Client submitting an OAS application), a user may add the "Initial Eligibility Period" Override to the case prior to authorization. This will not result in the Client meeting the Eligibility &amp; Entitlement criteria earlier than under normal circumstances, but will allow for the application to be approved even if the calculated earliest date of eligibility is beyond the 11 months following the receipt date of the application. The initial eligibility period override does not extend the retroactive period for applications submitted after the earliest date of eligibility. The system will calculate retroactive benefits, including underpayments, automatically. When a client requests a retroactive payment or underpayment be issued immediately, you can issue the priority payment through the Issue Retro Pending Payments function in the product delivery case. Refer to Manual Payment and Priority Payment—Record and Issue in Cúram (Action) Documents During a triage task, the processor may be unsure about where to move the document. A document should be reviewed to determine where it should be moved to by the processing agent. If the document is related to or in support of an application, then it should be moved to the Application Case. If the document is about the individual and not specific to a benefit, then it can reside at the person level. The user needs to determine why the document was provided and then move it to the appropriate location to action. There will be cases that a document has to go to the Person (e.g. paper application received and there is no Application Case) and then the document can be moved afterwards if required. A document received for a verification cannot be moved from a Task directly to the verification. Documents for verifications must be moved to the location where the verification exists (e.g. Person) and then can be moved to the verification. This process applies to all document types, as there are no rules that prevent a user from moving a document type to a Case or a Person. What you need to know Voluntary Tax Withhold (VTW) evidence captures the details of the monthly federal and/or provincial tax amount a client requested to have withheld from their OAS benefits. A client can request VTW using the Request for Voluntary Federal Income Tax Deductions CPP and OAS (ISP-3520) or section D3 Taxes of the Old Age Security and Guaranteed Income Supplement (ISP-3550) forms, or through their My Service Canada account. The evidence exists in both Integrated Cases and Application Cases. If the benefit is not authorized, the VTW evidence is maintained in the Application Case. If the benefit is authorized, the VTW evidence is maintained in the Integrated Case. VTW evidence can be added for a client at the Application Case level or Integrated Case level when their application is processed and after their case is active. Note: The provincial tax withholding type only applies to residents of Quebec. Quebec's provincial tax withholding is not applied until the 7th month after the date the first payment was issued. If VTW evidence needs to be updated (i.e. if the VTW evidence was 10% and is increased to 15%), the End Date should be entered for the existing VTW evidence and a new VTW evidence should be created with the new deduction value. This allows for traceability of evidence that were used in gross to net calculations. There are several cases in which a user would edit an existing voluntary tax withhold evidence: To correct incorrectly added information To update a client’s percentage or dollar amount based on a client’s request To stop the voluntary tax withhold based on a client’s request Note: If a user attempts to change the Start Date or End Date of a voluntary tax withhold evidence that has already been used in the gross to net payment calculation or gross to net processing period, the system will not allow the change and provide you with an error message. The cover period on a payment (i.e, transaction) provides the date range in which the voluntary tax withhold evidence was used. The earliest End Date that can be entered is the day after the cover period. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Add voluntary tax withhold evidence In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Determine where to add the voluntary tax withhold evidence: To add on an Application Case: Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the case in the Reference column. To add on an Integrated Case: Click Cases on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the Old Age Security case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab on the navigation bar. Hover over Voluntary Tax Withhold in the Deduction section and click the plus ( + ) icon. The New Voluntary Tax Withhold window opens. Enter the following details in the Voluntary Tax Withhold window: Table 1 — Field and Direction under Voluntary Tax Withhold Window Field Direction Date Received Mandatory Review the Date Received : If the date is correct, leave the field as is. If the date is incorrect, select the correct date from the calendar. Participant Mandatory The client's name is selected by default. Voluntary Tax Withhold Type Mandatory Select one of the following from the Voluntary Tax Withhold Type drop-down menu: Federal Provincial Note: The provincial tax withholding type only applies to residents of Quebec. Quebec's provincial tax withholding is not applied until the 7th month after the date the first payment was issued. Dollar Amount to be Withheld Enter the monthly amount the client has requested to be withheld. Percentage to be Withheld Enter the percentage of the client's monthly amount the client has requested to be withheld. Start Date Mandatory The date the withhold of tax begins. End Date The date the withhold of tax ended. Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . If the voluntary tax withhold evidence is in Application Case, the evidence will be active automatically. If the voluntary tax withhold evidence is in Integrated Case, the evidence moves to In Edit status. Refer to the Activate voluntary tax withhold evidence section below to activate the evidence. Click Cases on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the Old Age Security case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab on the navigation bar. Click In Edit Evidence on the page group navigation bar on the left. The In Edit Evidence window opens. Click the 3-dots ( ... ) action menu to display the action menu and click Apply Changes… . The Apply Changes window opens. Check the box for the Voluntary Tax Withhold evidence. Click Save . H2 Exp-coll: Determine cover period for the voluntary tax withhold End Date In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . What you need to know An ALW / ALWS application case is created when a new application for ALW and/or ALWS benefits is submitted in Cúram. An ALW / ALWS Application Case can be accessed from the person's profile. If a prospect person record exists due to the client information being received from a restricted country, you must register the Prospect Person as a Person before you proceed to authorize the ALW / ALWS benefit. Refer to Register a Prospect Person as a Person in Cúram (Action) . Cúram will determine the earliest eligibility date based on the eligibility criteria according to the information entered. All evidence must be active before authorizing an Application Case. This is to ensure the current eligibility determination is made regardless of the actual outcome. If there is a duplicate application with Open status, you must close one before you authorize the benefit. If an application is closed by mistake, you can also reopen the application manually. You will manually send the correspondence associated with the tasks based on the information required to process the application. When you select Authorize , a potential eligibility check record is created on the application case. On the eligibility check records, the user can view a detailed summary of all the criteria assessed to determine eligibility. The following screens can be used to view details of decisions for each criterion: Table 1—Decision and Detail for Each Criterion Decision Detail Approved The Approval tab on the Benefit line item can be expanded to view the criteria assessed. Closure The Closure tab on the Benefit line item can be expanded to view the criteria assessed. Evidence If an evidence issue exists, you can navigate to the evidence issue screen and view all the evidence which have an issue. Each individual evidence can be accessed to learn more about the issues. The details of the unmet criteria can be viewed by the client on the potential eligibility screen. This will confirm if there is any outstanding verification on the evidence. You can manually reopen a closed or withdrawn ALW / ALWS benefit on the Application Case. This is possible when an Administrative Error , Appeal Decision , Request for Reconsideration, and/or a Response Received from SSA Country reopening reasons are met. Consent required from spouse on ALW / ALWS cases Applications for OAS program benefits cannot be approved without a valid consent to the terms of the application and declaration of the truth of the information provided by all parties to the application. The Consent and Declaration evidence type captures this data for each participant on an Application Case. If the Application submitted for a client does not include the Consent for a participant, Cùram will generate a task stating that the Consent is required. This can be viewed from the Tasks tab on the application case. You must add the Consent and Declaration evidence and close this task prior to Authorization. If the task is not Closed, system will prevent the Authorization of the Application Case. Steps to follow when the ALW / ALWS is not showing up for a retroactive period The retroactive information is automatically calculated by Cùram. If an ALWS client was ineligible for the retroactive period, a separate application for ALW is not required. You can review the display rules for the retroactive period, to determine why the client is not eligible or not entitled. Note: Display rules can be accessed from the Determinations tab on the Product Delivery Case. You can select the coverage period for which they would like to view the determination by choosing the appropriate link. Guidance for processing ALW / ALWS applications if received simultaneously When processing ALW and ALWS applications received simultaneously, the following conditions should be verified: Was the client married on the Application Date ? If yes, an application for ALW must be added. Was the client a Surviving Spouse on the Application Date ? If yes, an application for ALWS must be added. If the conditions above are not met, there is no further processing required. Processing an ALWS application when there is a migrated OAS/ GIS application, but no spouse If you are processing an application for ALWS , but there is no spousal information, you can add an ALWS application for the client without the spousal information stating that the client is a Surviving Spouse. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: View an ALW / ALWS Application Case In Cúram, access the person's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. The list of available applications displays. Click the hyperlink of the application under the Reference column. The Application Case details open in a new tab. H2 Exp-coll: Manually authorize an ALW / ALWS application In Cúram, access the person's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. The list of client's applications will display. Click the applicable hyperlink of the application under the Reference column. Click the Benefits tab. Click the Authorize hyperlink at the end of the ALW / ALWS line. The Authorize Benefit window opens. Note: The Authorize Benefit window displays the outcomes of each criteria assessment for the client's eligibility. Note : If one criterion is not met, the Close action button is active. In this case, go to step 7. Click Close . Cúram updates the status from Pending to Closed . The Completed On field date is populated. Application case status is changed to Closed . Note: If all criteria are met, the Approve action button is active. In this case, go to step 8. Click Approve . The Authorize Benefit screen closes and Cúram will create the Integrated Case and the Product Delivery Case with the status Open . Cúram updates the status from Pending to Approved . The Completed On field date is populated. Application case status is changed to Closed . H2 Exp-coll: Manually reopen an ALW / ALWS application case In Cúram, go to the person's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Application on the page group navigation bar on the left. The list of available applications opens. Click the hyperlink for the application under the Reference column. Click the Benefits tab. Click the 3-dots ( ... ) action menu to display the action menu and click Reopen… . The Reopen Benefit window opens. Enter the following details in the Reopen Benefit window: Table 1—Field and Direction under Reopen Benefit Window Field Direction Date Select the applicable date under Date . Reason Select one of the following options under the Reason drop-down menu: Administrative Error Appeal Decision Request for Reconsideration Response Received from SSA Country Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . The Reopen Benefit screen closes. Benefit is reopened with status of Pending . The application status is now Open . Note: Cúram will verify if any evidence issues are created when the application case is reopened. If there is an evidence issue, the system creates a Task-193. This task has been included to ensure the Department's staff can resolve the evidence issues on an application case after it has been reopened. H2 Exp-coll: Print an ALW / ALWS application In Cúram, go to the person's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Application on the page group navigation bar on the left. The list of available applications opens. Click the hyperlink for the application under the Reference column. Click the Contacts tab. Click Attachments on the page group navigation bar on the left. The list of the available attachments opens. Click Edit at the right end of the Attachment page. The Edit Attachment screen opens. Click the hyperlink for the attached file. The application PDF will prompt a download window to save or print it. This could prevent the authorization of the application. If this issue exists, follow the steps below to resolve this issue and Authorize the Application. What you need to know Residence Period evidence captures a client's periods of residence in and outside of Canada since the age of 18. Only periods in Canada or periods deemed to have been in Canada, contribute to the entitlement determination. Periods in Canada as well as those in countries with whom Canada has a Social Security Agreement may be considered for the purposes of eligibility. A client may report a change in their current residence and, if they are no longer in Canada, they report the reason for the absence and whether they intend to return to the country. Note: A client may have multiple periods of residence if they resided outside of Canada (e.g. if they have employment outside of Canada). There must be one Residence Period evidence entry for each residence period. Note: Residence periods are also automatically added as part of the application intake process. An ESDC employee will be assigned a task to confirm each individual's type of Canadian residence (absence and/or deemed residence). The evidence exists in both Integrated Cases and Application Cases. If the benefit is not approved, the residence period evidence is maintained in the Application Case. If the benefit is approved, the residence period evidence is maintained in the Integrated Case. Refer to Application Case, Integrated Case and Product Delivery Case in Cùram (Knowledge) . In an Application Case, the evidence will be considered during the eligibility check and/or authorization process. Once the evidence is activated in the Integrated Case, it will trigger the Eligibility &amp; Entitlement rules and recalculation. Cúram will calculate residence for the purposes of Eligibility &amp; Entitlement consideration within the system. What you need to know Cúram uses different case types to reflect different business needs across the lifecycle for the delivery of OAS benefits. The fundamental case types include: Application Case Integrated Case Product Delivery Case H2 Exp-coll: Application Case An Application Case is created when the client applies for an OAS pension and/or OAS benefits (i.e. GIS and ALW and ALWS benefits) by submitting the application form either via paper or the client portal in Cúram. You can find an Application Case by clicking Applications on the page group navigation bar under the Cases and Applications tab of the Person profile. There are 2 types of Application Cases: OAS/ GIS Application Case ALW / ALWS Application Case It is important to accurately record all details provided by the client as appropriate evidences, prior to authorizing an Application Case. You can verify the client's potential eligibility using the Check Eligibility function prior to authorization. When you initiate the authorization process, Cúram conducts an eligibility check as the first step. An Application Case can be authorized once all information is gathered. If the authorization is approved and successful, the client is eligible for a benefit and will have their entitlement determined. A correspondence letter will be sent out automatically through Cúram to inform the client. If the required information is not received, the application case must be closed and could result in the client not being eligible for or entitled to benefits. A correspondence letter will be sent out automatically through Cúram to inform the client of the decision as well. You can manually reopen a closed or withdrawn Application Case when the situation allows. For example, if the client requests reconsideration of a decision, and the Department changes the decision after processing the reconsideration or if the Department receives the agreement information from another country. Both the OAS pension and GIS applications can exist in one Application Case. If that is the case, Cúram requires separate authorization for each benefit. Note: The OAS pension must be authorized and approved first to authorize and approve the GIS benefit. After the benefit authorization results in Approval, Cúram automatically creates the Integrated Case and Product Delivery Case to manage and deliver the benefit. If the Application Case has 2 benefits, Cúram still creates one Integrated Case and one Product Delivery Case after the first benefit is authorized and approved. Each Application Case contains the following tabs: Table 1—Tab Name and Detail in an Application Case Tab Name Detail Home The Home tab consists of: Home Urgent Flags The Home page provides a summary of the benefits, outstanding verifications and transaction history. The Urgent Flags page lists current and previous urgent flags assigned to the Application Case. If any enquiries under MP Enquiry, Ministerial Enquiry or Dire Needs are raised under the Contacts tab, the urgent flags will display here. Benefits The Benefits tab displays the benefits the client applied for. The list may include the: OAS Pension GIS Benefit ALW / ALWS Benefit Task The Tasks tab displays the tasks related to the Application Case. Contacts The Contacts tab consists of: Communications Attachments The Communications page contains recorded enquiries and letters sent to the clients related to the Application Case. The Attachments page contains all the links to the documentation stored in the Pension Trusted Digital Repository (e.g. application, supporting documents) associated with the Application Case. Evidence The Evidence tab stores case-specific evidence information. It consists of the following pages: Dashboard Evidence Issues Verifications Incoming Evidence The Dashboard page lists all the evidence that can be stored in the Application Case. When evidence is added or edited, Cúram determines if the new or updated evidence requires verification. If any evidence type requires attention for verification or issues, an icon will display next to the evidence name. The context panel also includes a summary of evidence verification and issues. If the evidence name is blue, it means the evidence has existing data. You can click the name of the evidence to view the details. The Evidence page lists all the active evidence related to the Application Case. An evidence will only be active when no verification or issue is present. The Issues page lists system-identified evidence issues in the Application Case that require attention. Issues are listed when Cúram detects an evidence is missing key information (e.g. marital relationship with incomplete data). The Verifications page lists all the evidence that require manual verification (e.g. adding proof to prove a client's legal status). The Incoming Evidence page displays common evidence that have been shared from other cases (e.g. an updated marital status). The incoming evidence will be displayed on this page, until it is updated or disregarded. Interfaces The Interfaces tab displays: Requests sent to the CRA; and/or Any income information received from the CRA. The types of requests include: Add to CRA Lifetime List Delete from CRA Lifetime List Income Inquiry Participants The Participants tab displays the information of all related clients and/or their spouses under the Application Case. It consists of: Current Participants Previous Participants The Participants page will only display if more than one participant is associated with the Application Case. The Current Participants page lists all case participants currently related to the Application Case. The Previous Participants page lists all the participants that are removed from the Current Participants page before the Application Case is authorized and the benefit was approved. Potential Eligibility The Potential Eligibility tab provides a preview of the eligibility results for benefits in the Application Case based on the available evidence at the time when you use the Check Eligibility functionality. To view the eligibility of each period, click Check Eligibility and a decision table will appear under the Eligibility Checks section title. The information displayed is based on the data currently available in Cúram. The types of decisions include: Eligible Not Eligible Related Cases The Related Cases tab displays the cases linked to the Application Case. The types of related cases include: Old Age Security (Integrated Case) Old Age Security Program Benefits (Product Delivery Case) Administration The Administration tab displays the transaction history and the case owner of the Application Case. It consists of the following pages: Transaction History User Roles The Transaction History page documents all the detailed actions that were taken on the Application Case. The User Roles page lists the case owner and case supervisor assigned to the Application Case. Appeals The Appeals tab displays the records of reconsiderations received on the Application Case. Note: The reconsiderations would only apply to closed benefits. Any requests for reconsideration on an approved decision or subsequent decisions will be processed at the Product Delivery Case level. H2 Exp-coll: Integrated Case The Integrated Case is used to store and manage case information for a benefit application that has been approved. You can find an Integrated Case by clicking Cases on the page group navigation bar under the Cases and Applications tab of the Person profile. The Integrated Case is referred to as Old Age Security case in the Name column. The Evidence tab in the Integrated Case includes evidence encoded in the Application Case and additional evidence related to the benefit. An Integrated Case contains the following tabs: Table 1—Tab Name and Detail in an Integrated Case Tab Name Detail Home The Home tab consists of: Home Urgent Flags The Home page provides a Reference link of the related Product Delivery Case and recent transactions of the Integrated Case. The Urgent Flags page lists current and previous urgent flags assigned to the Application Case. If any enquiries under MP Enquiry, Ministerial Enquiry or Dire Needs are raised under the Contacts tab, the urgent flags will display here. Eligibility The Eligibility tab displays an overview summary of the benefits the client receives. The list of benefits may include: OAS Pension GIS Benefit ALW / ALWS Benefit Overview The Overview tab displays a summary of the client's entitlements, including the start date, entitlement amount and hyperlinks to the history of determination and payments. Task The Tasks tab displays the tasks related to the Integrated Case. Certain types of enquiries trigger system tasks once they are recorded. Contacts The Contacts tab consists of: Communications Attachments The Communications page contains recorded enquiries and letters sent to the clients related to the Integrated Case. The Attachments page contains all the links to the documentation stored in the Pension Trusted Digital Repository (e.g. application, supporting documents) associated with the Application Case. Evidence The Evidence tab stores case-specific evidence information. It consists of the following pages: Dashboard Active Evidence In Edit Evidence Issues Verifications Incoming Evidence The Dashboard page lists all the evidence that can be stored in the Integrated Case. The list of evidence includes the evidence in the Application Case. When evidence is added or edited, Cúram determines if the new or updated evidence requires verification, activation or both. If any evidence type requires attention for activation, verification or issues, an icon will display next to the evidence name. If the evidence name is blue, it means the evidence has existing data. You can click the name of the evidence to view the details. The Active Evidence page lists all the evidence that is on the Integrated Case that has been verified and activated. The In Edit Evidence page lists evidence that requires activation. Note: Activating evidence may immediately impact the client's entitlement. It is recommended to use the Check Eligibility function under Administration tab of the Product Delivery Case to preview the potential entitlement. The Issues page lists system-identified evidence issues in the Integrated Case that require attention. Issues are listed when Cúram detects evidence is missing key information (e.g. marital relationship with incomplete data). The Verifications page lists all the evidence that require manual verification (e.g. adding proof to prove a client's legal status). The Incoming Evidence page displays common evidence that have been shared from other cases (e.g. an updated marital status). The evidence will be displayed on this page, until the incoming evidence is updated or disregarded it. Interfaces The Interfaces tab displays: Requests sent to the CRA; and/or Any income information received from the CRA. Note: The client's year-by-year CRA detailed received income will display in this tab. The types of requests include: Add to CRA Lifetime List Delete from CRA Lifetime List Income Inquiry Participants The Participants tab displays the information of all related clients and/or their spouses under the Application Case. It consists of the following pages: Case Members Case Participants Special Cautions The Case Members page lists the primary client and client's spouse or common-law partners, if applicable. The Case Participants page lists any participant associated with the Integrated Case, (e.g. primary client and authorized correspondents). The Special Cautions page lists any case-related Old Age Security Alert, including the following options: Additional Security Criteria Risk of Inaccurate Migrated Data Under Appeal Under Investigation with ISB Under Reconsideration Whereabouts Unknown Administration The Administration tab displays the transaction history and the case owner of the Integrated Case. It consists of the following pages: Transaction History Related Cases User Roles The Transaction History page documents all the detailed actions that were taken on the Integrated Case. The Related Cases page lists the related Application Case and Product Delivery Case. The User Roles page lists the case owner and case supervisor assigned to the Integrated Case. H2 Exp-coll: Product Delivery Case A Product Delivery Case stores the financial information required to pay benefit to a client. It contains the decision(s), including eligibility, entitlement, financial information and payment amounts. If there is a reassessment that spans across multiple benefit types, benefits can be managed with a single Product Delivery Case. You can find a Product Delivery Case by clicking Cases on the page group navigation bar under the Cases and Applications tab of the Person profile. The Product Delivery Case is referred as Old Age Security Program Benefits case in the Name column. Once a Product Delivery Case is created, benefits are delivered until: the benefit has been ceased or cancelled; any outstanding overpayments have been reimbursed; or any outstanding underpayments have been redeemed Table 1—Tab Name and Detail in a Product Delivery Case Tab Name Detail Home The Home tab consists of: Home Urgent Flags The Home page provides a summary of the case details, case members and recent transactions of the Product Delivery Case. The Urgent Flags page lists current and previous urgent flags assigned to the Product Delivery Case. Determination The Determination tab displays all the determination information for all coverage periods. It consists of the following pages: Current History The Current page lists all the current determination information based on the assessment. The History page lists previous determination information if there is a reassessment of the benefit. Refer to View Eligibility and Entitlement Results in Cúram (Action) . Task The Tasks tab displays the tasks related to the Product Delivery Case. Certain types of enquiries trigger system tasks once they are recorded. Contacts The Contacts tab consists of the following pages: Communications Attachments The Communications page contains recorded enquiries and letters sent to the clients related to the Product Delivery Case. The Attachments page contains all the documentation associated with the Product Delivery Case. Financials The Financials tab stores case-specific evidence information. It consists of the following pages: Transactions Certifications Deductions Components Delivery Patterns Nominees Over and Under Payment Payment Simulations Maximum Deduction Amount The Transactions page lists all the processed and unprocessed financial transactions. The Certifications page is not used by the Department. The Deductions page lists the applicable deduction types such as Program Specific Overpayment, OAS Recovery Tax, Federal Voluntary Tax Withhold, and Provincial Voluntary Tax Withhold. The information includes the deduction amount, and where the deduction is applied to. The Components page lists all the applicable financial components associated with the case. The financial components include: OAS pension GIS Benefit ALW Benefit ALWS Benefit The Delivery Pattern page lists the name of the nominee(s), payment method and at which frequency payments are delivered to the client. The Nominees page lists the third party representatives who are authorized to receive payments for the client. The Over and Under Payment page lists any overpayments and/or underpayments details. The Payment Simulations page enables simulating a future payment based on all available information encoded in Cúram at the moment of performing the simulation. However, this is not an eligibility and entitlement simulation. The Maximum Deduction Amount page lists the details the calculated recovery rate to be applied towards departmental overpayments, penalties and/or the interest on the client record. This is still part of the deduction, but it is more specifically about the calculation of what the overpayment deduction is going to be when issuing the payment. Appeal The Appeals tab displays the records of requests for reconsideration under the Product Delivery Case. Participants The Participants tab displays the information of all related clients and/or their spouses under the Application Case. It consists of the following pages: Case Members Case Participants Special Cautions The Case Members page lists the primary client and client's spouse or common-law partners, if applicable. The Case Participants page lists any participant associated with the Integrated Case (e.g. primary client and verified correspondent). The Special Cautions page lists any behavioral alert or safety alert flagged under any case member. Administration The Administration tab displays the transaction history and the case owner of the Product Delivery Case. It consists of the following pages: Transaction History Status History Related Cases User Roles Manual Eligibility Check The Transaction History page documents all the detailed actions that were taken on the Product Delivery Case. The Status History page lists the details if the case status changes. The Related Cases page lists the related Integrated Case. The User Roles page lists the case owner and case supervisor assigned to the Integrated Case. The Manual Eligibility Check page allows you to manually verify the client's eligibility when there are changes in evidence. If the evidence impacts the payment, it is recommended to use the Check Eligibility function before activating any new evidence to preview the potential payment. What you need to know An overpayment case is used to make a correction to a benefit when it has been recalculated. When an overpayment deduction is added, the client is given a 60-day notice period to respond. There are 2 types of overpayment cases: a Department employee manually creates an overpayment case; and payment correction cases created by Cúram when a recalculation is completed on previously paid benefits. Note: You can identify an Overpayment (Manual) and a Payment Correction case by the record name. Each have the case type followed by a reference number and name (e.g. Overpayment (Manual) 2000003094 – James Stone or Payment Correction – 1111111111 – James Stone). You can view manual overpayment information by navigating to the Transactions tab under the Financials tab on the Person level or the Transactions tab under the Financial tab on the Benefit Overpayment case. The following information is available: Transaction information (e.g. the type of overpayment, payee, method, processed date, status, due date and amount of the overpayment); Note: The projected end date for the recovery deduction is based on the maximum deduction amount. Status information; Deduction information; Note: The deduction percentage is 0.01% and the amount is $0.00 until the financial batches are run and they are automatically calculated. Overpayment and Underpayment details; Nominee information; and Maximum deduction amount information. Note: The recovery amount is created automatically. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Add a manual overpayment In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Financials tab. Note: You must enter an overpayment reference number in the Overpayment Reference Number field if you selected Reallocation from the Overpayment Reason drop-down menu. Fraud or Misrepresentation Select Fraud or Misrepresentation , if applicable. Liability Amount Mandatory Enter the overpayment amount. Overpayment Creation Date Mandatory Select the date the overpayment was created from the calendar. Overpayment Reference Number Enter the overpayment reference number. Note: You must enter an overpayment reference number if you selected Reallocation from the Overpayment Reason drop-down menu. Start Date Mandatory Enter the start date of the overpayment period. End Date Mandatory Enter the date the overpayment period ends. Click Next to go to the 2 Enter Product Delivery Case Details tab. Check the box for the appropriate product delivery case. Select the appropriate benefit from the Select Benefit Type drop-down menu. Click Save . Cúram validates the information and adds the overpayment record. Note: The wizard closes, and Cúram opens the Overpayment (Manual) screen in a new tab. The manual overpayment will remain In-Active status until the system performs its financial batch run (update). The system may create a task for approval based on the amount of overpayment. H2 Exp-coll: View manual overpayment information, maximum deduction amount, and overpayment and underpayment information In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Cúram validates the information and updates the overpayment information. The Edit Case window closes and Cúram returns to the Overpayment (Manual) screen. H2 Exp-coll: Suspend a manual overpayment In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Select one of the following options from the Reason drop-down menu: New Evidence Suspended in Error Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . The Overpayment (Manual) case status updates from Suspended to Active . H2 Exp-coll: Reverse a transaction in a manual overpayment In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . From the Home tab, click the Reference Number hyperlink of the Benefit Overpayment. The Overpayment (Manual) page opens in a new tab. Click the Financial tab on the navigation bar. Click Transactions on the page group navigation bar. What you need to know Recipients of an OAS pension or GIS can request the cancellation of these entitlements within the first 6 months of payment. When a request of cancellation is granted, all issued payments must be repaid. The pension or benefit may be cancelled provided the beneficiary repays all amounts received no later than 6 months after the day on which their request for a cancellation is granted. Note: When a request for cancellation is granted, you must create a task to verify the repayment status after 6 months. The purpose of this work item is to determine whether repayment has been made or if the benefit should be reinstated. If the client does not repay all amounts within 6 months, the benefit cancellation status must be changed to Delinquent . This will reinstate the benefits. When the Benefit Cancellation Request Status of the entitlement is changed to Repaid , and the change is applied, the Application Status is set to Cancelled . The Benefit Cancellation Request Evidence is applied to the OAS application case and the GIS application case will also be cancelled. The corresponding overpayment will be sent to PSCD once activated but will have a 10 month collection deferral date so the debt will not be sent to the CRA for collection. What you need to know You can add evidence, correct errors and update information on a client's profile record, as necessary. Once the client is registered, Cúram adds the submitted evidence to the Dashboard page and the Active Evidence page of the Evidence tab on the profile record. Refer to Register a Person in Cúram (Action) . Note: Depending on the evidence type, you may have to verify and/or activate the evidence so that it is available for use by Cúram. Whenever you are activating evidences, ensure that your changes were applied by checking the Active Evidence tab and the Dashboard tab. The following client's person record evidence is accessed on the Dashboard : Addresses Foreign Bank Details Names Bank Accounts Gender Details Office Of Control Consent to Deduction and Payment Identification Phone Number Contact Preferences (Preferred Language of Oral Communication and Preferred Language of Written) Last Province at Time of Application Third Party Contact Email Addresses Marital status Note: Birth and death details evidence is only available on the Active Evidence page. Note: Updating the marital status in one case automatically updates the status in the spouse's case. The steps for managing the following evidence types are described in the references listed below: Table 1—Existing References for Evidence Types Evidence References Names Change Identification Information (SIN, Names, Date of Birth) in Cúram (Action) SIN Change Identification Information (SIN, Names, Date of Birth) in Cúram (Action) Addresses Addresses—View, Edit, Add, Delete and Capture in Cúram (Action) Birth Change Identification Information (SIN, Names, Date of Birth) in Cúram (Action) Death Death Details Evidence — Edit in Cúram (Action) Consent to deduction and payment Consent to Deduction and Payment Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) Third Party Contact Third Party Contacts—Add, View, Edit, and Delete in Cúram (Action) Contact preferences The contact preference evidence is where the preferred language or oral communication, preferred language of written communication, and the preferred method of correspondence (including tax slips) can be updated. Verification items for Birth and Death Details evidence Cúram accepts a variety of items to be used as proof to verify the Birth and Death Details evidence. The acceptable items for Date of Birth are listed below: Birth Certificate Baptismal Certificate/Records Citizenship or Immigration Records Marriage Certificate/Records Foreign Documents Affidavit/Declaration Census Church Records Educational Records Employment/Pension Records Private/Personal Records Indian Treaty Status Card Métis Script Records Insurance or Government Annuities Medical Records Military Service or Veterans Affairs Public and Vital Statistics Other Restricted Liaison Liaison Cúram accepts a variety of items to be used as proof for Birth and Death Details evidence. The acceptable items for Date of Death are listed below: Registration of Death Death Certificate Religious Proof of Death Medical Proof of Death SSA Proof of Death Federal Proof of Death Provincial Proof of Death Other The 2 Birth and Death Details verifications may appear as outstanding verifications and are not duplicate actions. One verification is used to verify the Date of Birth details, and the second verification is used to verify the Date of Death details. Note: Document status can be edited by clicking Edit on the verification attachment. The document status is required for verification. Bank Account Information Updated When you receive new banking information for a client, it should be entered as a new bank account on the Person Evidence Case. There are only 2 cases where a user should use the Edit function on a Bank Account Evidence: To correct incorrect information previously entered, and no payments have been made to that account. The client has communicated that the bank account has been permanently closed, and the Account Status can be updated to Closed . The Account Name must be entered as or changed to alphabetical characters that reflect the client’s name. You must use the following formatting for the Account Name field for individual accounts: Use the first letter of the client’s first name, followed by a space and their full last name. Example A Smith Note: Do not enter a period after the first letter of the client’s first name and ensure there is a space between the first initial and the last name. If a middle name is provided, it can be abbreviated to an initial and placed between the first initial and the last name, separated by spaces. Example A J Smith The Account Name field in Cúram has a character limit of 60. However, when sharing the new direct deposit information with CPP, the Account Name entered in Cúram must be limited to 30 characters to comply with Account Holder name input requirements for ITRDS . For individual accounts exceeding this limit only , you must follow the instructions below: In Cúram: Update the direct deposit information for OAS, ensuring the above account name formatting is followed. Do not check the Use for CPP checkbox. In ITRDS , provide detailed notes indicating that due to character limits, the direct deposit was only updated in Cúram. Fill out the Communication between programs (ISP-0435) form, noting that the direct deposit information has been updated for OAS and requires review by CPP. Refer to Communication Between Programs (ISP-0435) Form (Action) . If a user receives any validation message regarding missing, cancelled, closed, or duplicated bank branches when attempting to add a new bank account evidence, then you must send a ticket to the National Service Desk Internal link . Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) receives data from Canadian financial institutions regarding changes to a client’s direct deposit information. Once PSPC verifies the Standard Payment System and performs updates, they create a Notice of Change File which is sent to the Department. When the Notice of Change is received from PSPC to update direct deposit information, Cúram attempts to automatically update it for clients. If Cúram is unable to automatically update the direct deposit information based on the Notice of Change, a task will be generated. You must review the client's information and manually add the direct deposit information. This will ensure that payment goes to the correct bank account. Direct Deposit Link Updated After the new bank account is added and applied, the account must be linked to the OAS program using the Direct Deposit Link functionality under the Financials tab on the Person Evidence Case, starting with the correct date (either current or future). This linking step ensures that the new bank account information is applied to the Product Delivery Case automatically. There are only two cases where a user should use the Edit function on a Direct Deposit Link: To correct information that has been entered incorrectly. To end-date the direct deposit link, as the client is switching to receive payment by cheque. If a client reports new banking information, you must add a new direct deposit link. This will end-date the previous direct deposit link automatically. New direct deposit information for all clients must be recorded as a Joint Account and the Account Name must be entered as or changed to alphabetical characters that reflect the clients' name. For more information, refer to Managing Bank Account Evidence for Joint Bank Accounts in Cúram (Action) . New If the client indicated that they want their direct deposit to start in the future and you enter that date in the Start Date field, the system will automatically update the Product Delivery Case when the future date arrives. If direct deposit information has been received for a client that is not yet an OAS client (e.g. they are too young), there will be no person record in Cúram. You must add a note in ITRDS that the client has never applied for OAS and send the OAS, Direct Deposit, Form incorrect or incomplete, ask client to complete form (ISS-8584) letter to the client. You do not need to create a Prospect Person. The direct deposit correspondence that was received can be shredded. Foreign Bank Details Information Below are the different processes to follow depending on the method that the department receives a foreign bank details request. H2 Exp-coll: Client Portal application Foreign Bank Details evidence is automatically created on a client's account, and a task is automatically generated when a client submits a new application with foreign bank details via the Client Portal. You must review the client's application and complete processing activities but do not authorize the benefit. If the client is eligible and entitled for a benefit, you must forward the outstanding foreign bank details task to the Foreign Direct Deposit unit's work queue (i.e. OAS-Foreign-Direct-Deposit ) and update ITRDS notes. The Foreign Direct Deposit unit must then process the foreign bank details in the Standard Payment System, update ITRDS notes and forward the task back to the OAS processing officer who has the client's application case task assigned to them. This information can be found on the client's case Tasks page. If there is no OAS processing officer with the application case task reserved, then the Foreign Direct Deposit unit must assign it to the appropriate regional processing work queue based on the client's Office of Control. H2 Exp-coll: Paper application In the rare case that a client submits foreign direct deposit information with their paper application, you must select Cheque in the Payment Destination section of the Applicant Details wizard when adding the application to Cúram . Complete all processing activities, including authorizing the benefit. If the client is eligible and entitled for a benefit, you must: Create a new manual task as follows: Table 2. Manual task details for foreign direct deposit information with a paper application Field Direction Subject Enter "Received &lt;receipt date&gt; – Foreign Direct Deposit Request". Category Select OAS Maintenance . Type Select Foreign Direct Deposit . Priority Select Medium . Due Date Select a date 30 days from current date. Assigned to (Work queue) Select OAS-Foreign-Direct-Deposit . The Foreign Direct Deposit unit must then add the foreign bank details in the Standard Payment System and in Cúram on the Person record. Add the Foreign Bank Details . Add or update the Bank Accounts evidence using the generic bank account details as follows: Table 3. Generic bank account details Field Value Branch Transit Number 00082 Financial Institution Number 260 Account Number 999999999999 Add a corresponding Direct Deposit Link . Complete the task, if applicable. Update ITRDS notes. H2 Exp-coll: Foreign direct deposit request At intake, support clerks will triage foreign direct deposit requests and set the Document Type to Foreign Direct Deposit . This will generate a task assigned directly to the Foreign Direct Deposit unit's work queue (i.e. OAS-Foreign-Direct-Deposit ). The Foreign Direct Deposit unit must add the foreign bank details in Standard Payment System and in Cúram on the Person record: Add the Foreign Bank Details Add or update the Bank Accounts evidence using the generic bank account details as follows: Table 4. Generic bank account details Field Value Branch Transit Number 00082 Financial Institution Number 260 Account Number 999999999999 Add a corresponding Direct Deposit Link . Complete the task, if applicable. Update ITRDS notes. Evidence exception When there is an evidence exception on the person profile, it is due to information provided during the application process causing a conflict in the system. It will be displayed on the Tasks Type. The Type will display Evidence Exception(s) . This can be viewed from the Tasks tab on the Person profile or on the Type field on the task. Note: The evidence exception is only displayed on the person profile and will not appear on the case. If there is an evidence exception, you must compare the evidence exception against the In-Edit evidence to determine if they match. If they do not match, you must determine which data is accurate and make the corrections using Change Identification Information . After making this change, or if the information matches, click Resolve on the Evidence Exceptions page.
