Do not modify or delete.)</content></document><document><reference>https://kmt-ogc.service.gc.ca/en/knowledgebase/article-latest?pid=KA-05520&amp;cid=CAT-02019</reference><title>Manage Cancelled Legacy Payments in Cúram (Action)</title><video_link>[-1]</video_link><video_name>['placeholder']</video_name><walkme_flow_id>[-1]</walkme_flow_id><walkme_flow_name>['placeholder']</walkme_flow_name><content>Overview Summary This procedure provides you with the steps to action and record re-issued cancelled legacy payments in Cúram for OAS client accounts migrated from both the OAS Online and International Agreement (IA) legacy systems. What you need to know Note: Any Year to Date values for cancelled legacy payments issued between January and March 2025 that are subsequently cancelled in 2025 cannot be modified in Cúram. You must adjust them using temporary screens in ITRDS . Payments are issued, returned, and cancelled through the Standard Payment System (SPS) on behalf of the government of Canada. When a payment is cancelled in SPS, Cúram will receive a cancelled payment file and create a task to review the cancelled legacy payment. Unlike Cúram-issued cancelled payments, when the payment is issued before migration to Cúram, it cannot be resolved systematically. OAS clients from the OAS Online and IA legacy systems will be migrated into Cúram. For clients migrating from OAS Online, Cúram generates a lump sum legacy payment of all the client’s historical entitlements during the cutover process. The legacy payment is based on the first eligibility and entitlement reassessment upon the migration of historical evidence. Historical eligibility and entitlement information from 2010 onwards will be migrated. During migration, the following items will be created: an OAS Integrated Case; a Product Delivery Case; financial components; and a payment record based on the created financial components. For clients migrating from the IA system, no historical entitlement data will be migrated for IA clients and no financial information will be generated for periods prior to migration. This means that Cúram will assume that it has not paid any amount to the client. During migration, the following items will be created: an OAS Integrated Case; a Product Delivery Case; and current financial components including entitlements, deductions and payment Information OAS/IA YTD Adjustment ( ITRDS screen) The OAS/IA YTD Adjustment ITRDS screen is a tool used to record and manage year-to-date (YTD) adjustments for OAS and IA payments. It was created to: record the YTDs for entitlements and deductions for OAS legacy payments that were determined prior to migration and will not or may not be reissued in 2025. These payments include those cancelled from January to March 2025. The legacy cancelled payments are not recognized by Cúram. These could be payments issued or not (e.g. no payment due to full recovery). provide the ability to manage these values due to cancelled payments. For more information, refer to Modify OAS-IA legacy system's Year-To-Date (YTD) for January to March 2025 Internal link . When a legacy payment is cancelled, you must determine if any liabilities and/or deductions were included in the legacy payments. If reversible deductions were included, they must be reversed in Cúram. If these liabilities/deductions still exist on reissuance, you must apply them as deductions when re-issuing the payment. If there are non-reversible liabilities/deductions, the amount of non-reversible deductions must be taken into consideration on reissuance of the payment. H2 Exp-coll: Cancel a legacy payment When the Standard Payment System cancels a payment, a task is created to notify staff of the cancellation in Cúram. You must then do the following: Amend the tax slip for the year of the cancelled legacy payment. Refer to Tax Slips — Create, Modify, Delete, Amend, Issue, Cancel, Reverse Cancellation and Issue Duplicate in Cúram (Action) . Reverse the reversible deductions by manually adjusting totals. The payment amount in Cúram may differ from the payment amount in the legacy system, resulting in an underpayment or overpayment. H2 Exp-coll: Re-issuing the cancelled legacy payment If a legacy payment needs to be re-issued, you must first complete the Canada Pension Plan Requisition for Manual Priority Payments (Canadian Funds) (ISP-1669-OAS or ISP-1669-IO) form to issue a manual priority payment from SAP. The manual priority payment is for the gross amount of the cancelled legacy payment, less the non-reversible and any reversible deductions. Re-issued cancelled legacy payments are recorded using the Account Adjustment functionality in Cúram. Do not use the manual payment functionality. You must also update the deduction totals if any deductions were applied. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: Manage deductions from a cancelled legacy payment In Cúram, reverse the deductions by manually adjusting totals: For the non-reversible deductions or other situations of non-entitlement as shown in the tables in the What you need to know section of the Overview tab, create a manual overpayment to account. Refer to Overpayment (Manual) Case—Add, View, Edit, Suspend and Delete in Cúram (Action) . For the reversible deductions (interest, penalty or CPP cross program), edit the liability amount in the outstanding balance. Refer to Manage Penalties and Interest on Overpayments in Cúram (Action) and Liability Allocation—View, Create, Deactivate, Reactivate and Delete in Cúram (Action) . H2 Exp-coll: Record a manually re-issued cancelled legacy payment In Cúram, go to client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Financials tab. Click the Transactions tab in the page group navigation bar on the left. The Transactions page opens. Click New Account Adjustment . The New Account Adjustment Reason screen opens. Select one of the following options from the Reason from Adjustment drop-down menu: Cancelled Legacy Payment Cancelled Legacy Payment with Deduction Click Next . The Legacy Payment Account Adjustment window opens. Enter the gross amount if no deductions were withheld. SPS Issue Date Mandatory Select the date the payment was issued by the Standard Payment System (SPS) from the calendar. Note: When applying a cancelled payment to a non-related overpayment, the SPS Issue Date is today’s date. Payment Reference Number Mandatory Enter the SPS payment reference number. Note: When applying a cancelled payment to a non-related overpayment, enter 001 in the Payment Reference Number field. Agreements System and Network Outages Training You are here: Home System Actions Cúram Work Tools Cúram Evidence (Work Tool) Cúram Evidence (Work Tool) Expand All Person Record Updated Addresses Bank Accounts Birth and Death Details New Consent to Deduction and Payment Contact Preferences Email Addresses Foreign Bank Details Gender Details Date of Birth Last Province at Time of Application Marital Status Names Office of Control Phone Number Third Party Contact CRA Birth and Death Details CRA Lifetime List CRA Marital Status SIN Identification Status Addresses Direction This evidence captures the home and mailing address of the client. A client can only have one home address. A change to the home address completed in Cúram or ITRDS will automatically be sent to the other system. A client can have the same or different mailing addresses for each program. When a client is requesting the same mailing address for both programs, select Use for CPP in Cúram. If the applicant has not provided a home address or has only provided a post office box, request the home address. Refer to Post Office Boxes (Action) . The applicant’s profile must be retained in the Office of Control (OCON) where the applicant resides, and not the OCON of the individual holding power of attorney or the trustee. A home address change can affect the following tax withholds: Federal Voluntary Tax Withhold; Provincial Voluntary Tax Withhold; and Non-Resident Tax. To add or edit an address in Cúram, refer to Addresses—View, Edit, Add, Delete and Capture in Cúram (Action) . Bank Accounts Direction This evidence captures the banking information provided by a client. When a client is requesting the same mailing address for both programs, select Use for CPP in Cúram. If the applicant is requesting to add or change the existing direct deposit information, update it in Cúram. Refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . If the applicant has not provided banking details, their benefits will be paid to them by cheque. Birth and Death Details New Direction This evidence captures the client’s birth and death details. Compare the client's date of death in Cúram to the date of death in ITRDS to confirm they match. If they do not match, refer to Validate a Proof of Death (Action) . For more information about the steps to follow when the Department receives notification that a client has died, refer to Death Notification (Scenario) . To edit the date of death, refer to Death Details Evidence — Edit in Cúram (Action) . To edit the date of birth, refer to the Date of Birth section below. Consent to Deduction and Payment Direction The Consent to Deduction and Payment evidence captures the applicant’s consent to reimburse benefits to the Social Assistance Agency. For more information about the reimbursement of benefits, refer to Reimbursement to Provincial Social Services Agencies, Workers’ Compensation Program Agencies or Private Insurers (Scenario) . To manage the details in Cúram, refer to Consent to Deduction and Payment Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Contact Preferences Direction To edit the applicant's preferred language of written or oral communication, refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . If the applicant does not indicate their preferred language, presume it is the one used in the application. A client can choose a different official language for oral and written communications. Notify the CPP program of any changes to the client’s preferred language using your existing procedures. Email Addresses Direction An applicant can provide an email address as an alternate means of communication. Warning: At this time, the Department is committed to recording a client's email address, but email is not an approved method of communication with clients or legal representatives. Do not communicate with the client by email. To manage an email address, refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . Foreign Bank Details Direction This evidence captures an applicant’s request for Foreign Direct Deposit to be added or updated on their account. Foreign banking evidence will be created with the detailed foreign banking information. The Foreign Direct Deposit unit in Halifax is responsible for capturing the Foreign Direct Deposit details. A task will be automatically created specifically for the foreign banking evidence. You must assign this task directly to the Foreign Direct Deposit work queue. Refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . If the applicant is applying from a foreign country, refer to Countries of the world for a payment in the Standard Payment System External link for details on foreign direct deposit and cheque availability for each country. Gender Details Direction This evidence captures the gender of the applicant. To edit the gender details, refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . Date of Birth Direction This evidence captures the date of birth of the applicant. Compare the applicant's date of birth in Cúram to the date of birth in ITRDS to confirm they match. If they do not match, refer to Validate the Date of Birth (Action) . To edit the date of birth refer to Change Identification Information (SIN, Names, Date of Birth) in Cúram (Action) . If the applicant is applying more than one year before their 65th birthday, the application will be denied as the age requirement has not been met. Advise the applicant to reapply at a later date. Note: If the application was received by the Department before the applicant's 64th birthday but you are processing it after their 64th birthday, do not deny the application. Process the application as usual and request any additional information required due to the application being submitted early. Last Province at Time of Application Direction This evidence captures the province or territory where the applicant last resided for applicants who indicated a foreign residential address on their application. It will be used to determine the Office of Control and to allocate tasks when the applicant does not have any Canadian residence captured in Cúram. To edit the Last Province at Time of Application in Cúram, refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . Marital Status Direction This evidence captures an applicant’s legal marital status. Compare the information provided by the applicant to the information on the CRA Marital Status Evidence in Cúram. Refer to Marital Status (Scenario) . Contact the applicant if they have: not completed this section on the application; or provided information that does not match. This information can be obtained by phone and recorded in ITRDS notes. However, if there is a discrepancy, clarification must be obtained in writing. Refer to Request Documentation or Information by Phone or Mail (Action) . To manage the marital status in Cúram, refer to Marital Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Names Direction This evidence captures the name of the applicant. Compare the applicant’s name in Cúram to the name as it appears in ITRDS to confirm they match. If they do not match, refer to Validate a Name (Action) . To edit a name: in Cúram, refer to Change Identification Information (SIN, Names, Date of Birth) in Cúram (Action) . in ITRDS , refer to Modify a Name in ITRDS (Action) . Office of Control Direction The Office of Control (OCON) determines which office is responsible for and has control over an applicant’s account. To manage the office of control information in Cúram, refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . Phone Number Direction This evidence captures the phone number(s) provided by the applicant. Compare the telephone number(s) in Cúram with the telephone number(s) recorded in ITRDS . If any telephone numbers are missing, update the applicable system: In Cúram, refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) . In ITRDS , refer to Telephone Number or Email Address—Add or Modify in ITRDS (Action) . Third Party Contact Direction This evidence captures the individual or organization that can be added as a third party contact to an applicant’s profile. If a third party is applying on behalf of a person, they must provide proof of their authority to act as the legal representative. Refer to Third Party Requests (Scenario) . To manage Third Party Contact information in Cúram, refer to Third Party Contacts—Add, View, Edit, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . CRA Birth and Death Details Direction This evidence captures an applicant’s date of birth and death details as reported by the CRA and cannot be modified. To view the evidence details in Cúram, refer to CRA Birth and Death Details—View in Cúram (Action) . If the birth and death details do not match, a task is created to process the death match file from the CRA and address the discrepancy between the CRA birth and death details evidence and the Department’s birth and death details evidence. CRA Lifetime List Direction This evidence captures information about an applicant’s lifetime status. For more information, refer to CRA Lifetime List (Action) . To view an applicant’s CRA lifetime list status and to manually add or delete an applicant to or from the CRA lifetime list in Cúram, refer to CRA Lifetime List—View, Add or Delete in Cúram (Action) . CRA Marital Status Direction This evidence captures an applicant’s new or updated marital status details reported by the CRA . To view an applicant’s CRA Marital Status in Cúram, refer to CRA Marital Status Evidence—View in Cúram (Action) . If the CRA marital status does not match the client's marital status evidence, a task is created to address the discrepancy. SIN Identification Status Direction This evidence captures an applicant's SIN. To add or edit a SIN in Cúram, refer to Change Identification Information (SIN, Names, Date of Birth) in Cúram (Action) . If the applicant does not have a SIN, refer to KA-04656 Applicant does not have a SIN (Action) (article not available). Application Case and Integrated Case Application Details Deemed Date Benefit Cancellation Request Benefit Cessation Benefit Suspension Decline GIS Eligibility and Entitlement Override First Entry Into Canada Details I ncarceration Legal Status Living Apart for Reasons Beyond Control Consent to be Disadvantaged Marital Relationship Nature of Absences Residence Period Sponsorship Sponsorship Agreement Benefits From Another Country CRA Income Foreign Income Manually Entered Income Retirement or Pension Reduction Statement of Estimated Income Estimated Income World Income Evidence Consent to Deduction and Payment Social Assistance Payment Non-Residential Tax Correction OAS RI Non-filer OAS Recovery Tax Voluntary Tax Withhold Application Details Direction This evidence captures: what benefits an applicant applied for; the dates that affect when the benefit starts; and the status of the application. It is also used to manage the process of withdrawing an OAS pension from a pending Application Case or an open Integrated Case. If the applicant indicates a future start date that is greater than 12 months from the date of receipt of their application, the application must be withdrawn. Refer to Withdraw an Application (Scenario) . Refer to Application Lifecycle Evidence—View, Edit and Add in Cúram (Action) . Deemed Date Direction This evidence can be used to record multiple deemed application dates for one application (e.g. incapacity, administrative error, erroneous advice and protective date). For more information, refer to Receipt Date and Date Protection (Action) . To manage the deemed date in Cúram, refer to Application Lifecycle Evidence—View, Edit and Add in Cúram (Action) . Benefit Cancellation Request Direction This evidence captures an applicant’s request to cancel OAS benefits within the first 6 months of payment. For more information, refer to KA-05344 Cancellation of OAS Benefits (Scenario) (article not available). To manage the cancellation request in Cúram, refer to Benefit Cancellation Request—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Benefit Cessation Direction This evidence captures an applicant’s request to stop receiving an OAS pension or benefit. For more information, refer to Cessation—OAS Pension and Benefits (Policy) . To manage a request to cease a benefit in Cúram, refer to Cessation Evidence—View, Add, Edit and Discard in Cúram (Action) . Benefit Suspension Direction This evidence is used to temporarily pause future generated payments of an active benefit. For information on suspending a benefit, refer to Suspend Benefits (Scenario) . To manage the suspension of a benefit in Cúram, refer to OAS Program Benefit Suspension—View, Suspend, Edit, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Decline GIS Direction This evidence records an applicant’s preference not to receive future GIS correspondences. Refer to Decline GIS Evidence—Add, Edit , View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Eligibility and Entitlement Override Direction This evidence is used when the detailed information in Cúram is not enough to determine an applicant’s eligibility and entitlement for OAS benefits (e.g. for migrated accounts, International Operations accounts where totalization is required with Unstructured Foreign Creditable periods). Refer to: Eligibility and Entitlement Override Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) ; and Foreign Creditable Period—Add, View, Edit or Delete in Cúram (Action) . First Entry Into Canada Details Direction This evidence records an applicant’s date of entry into Canada. It is mandatory for applicants who were born outside of Canada. If the applicant has not answered the question, obtain the information in writing. Refer to Request Documentation or Information by Phone or Mail (Action) . To manage this information in Cúram, refer to First Entry into Canada Details Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Incarceration Direction This evidence captures information about an applicant’s period of incarceration. For more information, refer to Incarceration—Limiting Payment of OAS Pension and Benefits (Scenario) . To manage incarceration details in Cúram, refer to Incarceration Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Legal Status Direction This evidence captures information about an applicant’s legal status. The applicant must provide details related to their legal status. If the applicant has not provided information regarding their legal status, obtain the information in writing. Refer to Request Documentation or Information by Phone or Mail (Action) . Use the information provided to validate the declared legal status. Refer to Legal Status (Scenario) . To manage the legal status evidence in Cúram, refer to Legal Status—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Living Apart for Reasons Beyond Control Direction This evidence captures the date and the reason an applicant and their spouse started living apart due to reasons beyond their control. For more information, refer to Couples Living Apart for Reasons Beyond Their Control (Scenario) . To manage this information in Cúram, refer to Marital Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Consent to be Disadvantaged Direction This evidence captures that a couple is living apart for reasons beyond their control and: that it is to the overall advantage of the couple but to the disadvantage of one member. The applicant who is disadvantaged must give consent to receive a lower entitlement amount. For more information, refer to Couples Living Apart for Reasons Beyond Their Control (Scenario) . To manage this information in Cúram, refer to Marital Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Marital Relationship Direction This evidence captures the relationship details such as: the relationship type; the duration; and the related spouse or common-law partner (i.e. participant). It also tracks changes in the relationship status. For more information, refer to Marital Status (Scenario) . To manage the marital relationship details in Cúram, refer to Marital Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Nature of Absences Direction This evidence captures details regarding the nature of a client’s absence in their residence history (e.g. specified circumstances). To review and validate the applicant's absences from Canada, refer to Validate Residence (Scenario) . To manage this information in Cúram, refer to Residence Period—Add, View and Edit in Cúram (Action) . Residence Period Direction This evidence captures an applicant’s periods of residence in and outside of Canada since the age of 18. To review and validate the applicant's declared residence history, refer to Validate Residence (Scenario) . If the applicant lived in a country with which Canada has an International Social Security Agreement in force and does not meet the minimum Canadian residence requirements, transfer the application to International Operations. Refer to Transfer a Client's File to International Operations (Action) . If the applicant indicated that they have worked in another country but did not apply for a benefit from that country, refer to Send a Foreign Benefit Application (Action) . To add or edit residence periods in Cúram, refer to Residence Period—Add, View and Edit in Cúram (Action) . Sponsorship Direction This evidence records whether an applicant entered Canada under a sponsorship agreement. For more information, refer to KA-01737 Validate a Sponsorship (Action) (article not available). To manage this information in Cúram, refer to Manage Sponsorship Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Sponsorship Agreement Direction This evidence is used to capture the details of the sponsorship period. For more information, refer to KA-01737 Validate a Sponsorship (Action) (article not available). To manage the sponsorship details in Cúram, refer to Manage Sponsorship Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Benefits From Another Country Direction This evidence captures foreign residence and/or work information for an ALW or ALWS applicant or for their deceased spouse or common-law partner. Refer to Benefit from Another Country Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . CRA Income Direction This evidence contains income information shared by the CRA . For more information, refer to: Validate Income for Income-Tested Benefits (Action) ; and CRA Lifetime List (Action) . Refer to CRA Income—View and Request New Income in Cúram (Action) . Foreign Income Direction This evidence captures information about an applicant’s income from foreign sources as reported by the applicant. For more information, refer to Validate Income for Income-Tested Benefits (Action) . To manage foreign income in Cúram, refer to Foreign Income Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Manually Entered Income Direction This evidence records the income reported by the client on a GIS application or a statement of income, or modified CRA income used for calculating an applicant’s GIS, ALW benefit or ALWS benefit entitlement. For more information, refer to Validate Income for Income-Tested Benefits (Action) . To manage manually entered income in Cúram, refer to Manually Entered Income Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Retirement or Pension Reduction Direction This evidence captures the date of an applicant’s optionable event when they: suffer a loss in pension income; or retire from employment or self-employment. To determine if a Statement of Estimated Income after Retirement or Reduction in Pension Income Year 20XX (ISP-3041) form must be sent to the applicant, refer to Validate an Optionable Event (Action) . To manage the event date in Cúram, refer to Retirement or Pension Income Reduction Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Statement of Estimated Income Direction This evidence captures detailed information regarding the reduction or cessation of pension and/or employment income or benefits. For more information, refer to Options (Scenario) . To manage the event details in Cúram, refer to Statement of Estimated Income Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Estimated Income Direction This evidence records the actual income information needed to calculate an option or any income that needs to be estimated. For more information, refer to Options (Scenario) . To manage the estimated or actual income details in Cúram, refer to Statement of Estimated Income Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . World Income Evidence Direction This evidence captures whether an applicant’s total world income is above the annual threshold for the OAS recovery tax. If the applicant has: not answered the question on the application, obtain the information by phone. Refer to Request Documentation or Information by Phone or Mail (Action) . If the applicant cannot be reached by phone, refer to KA-04549 OAS Recovery Tax (Scenario) (article not available). answered no to this question on the application, they are not subject to the OAS Recovery Tax. Continue reviewing the application. answered yes to this question, refer to KA-04549 OAS Recovery Tax (Scenario) (article not available). To manage the world income details in Cúram, refer to World Income Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Consent to Deduction and Payment Direction This evidence captures the applicant’s consent to reimburse benefits to the Social Assistance Agency. For more information about the reimbursement of benefits, refer to Reimbursement to Provincial Social Services Agencies, Workers’ Compensation Program Agencies or Private Insurers (Scenario) . To manage the details in Cúram, refer to Consent to Deduction and Payment Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Social Assistance Payment Direction This evidence captures the payment amounts that were paid by the Social Assistance Agency to the applicant. For more information about the reimbursement of benefits, refer to Reimbursement to Provincial Social Services Agencies, Workers’ Compensation Program Agencies or Private Insurers (Scenario) . To manage the details in Cúram, refer to Consent to Deduction and Payment Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Non-Residential Tax Correction Direction This evidence is automatically created when an OAS benefits Product Delivery Case is created for an applicant whose current and/or future residential address is not within Canada, the United States or the United Kingdom. This evidence provides the start date, end date and the percentage of the non-resident tax withhold deduction. To view this evidence in Cúram, or if a manual edit is required, refer to Non-Residential Tax Withhold—View and Edit in Cúram (Action) . OAS RI Non-filer Direction This evidence exists when an applicant has not filed their OAS return of income on time. For more information, refer to KA-04549 OAS Recovery Tax (Scenario) (article not available). To manage the non-filer status in Cúram, refer to Non-Filer Evidence—Add, Edit and View in Cúram (Action) . OAS Recovery Tax Direction This evidence captures the OAS recovery tax rate provided by the CRA . OAS recovery tax evidence should only be added and edited when you are instructed to do so by the CRA . To add or edit the OAS Recovery tax in Cúram, refer to OAS Recovery Tax Evidence—Add, View and Edit in Cúram (Action) . Voluntary Tax Withhold Direction This evidence captures the details of the monthly federal and/or provincial tax amount an applicant has requested to have withheld from their OAS benefits. Refer to Voluntary Tax Withhold (Scenario) . To manage the Voluntary Tax Withhold details in Cúram, refer to Voluntary Tax Withhold Evidence—Add, Edit, View and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Title * * Comments * * Your contact information Name * * Email * * * *</content></document><document><reference>https://kmt-ogc.service.gc.ca/en/knowledgebase/article-latest?pid=KA-05524&amp;cid=CAT-01960</reference><title>Foreign Engagement Case — Add, View, Edit and Close in Cúram (Action)</title><video_link>[-1]</video_link><video_name>['placeholder']</video_name><walkme_flow_id>[-1]</walkme_flow_id><walkme_flow_name>['placeholder']</walkme_flow_name><content>Overview Summary This procedure provides you with the steps to follow to add, view, edit and close a Foreign Engagement Case (FEC) under a Person’s profile in Cúram. What you need to know An FEC captures all information relating to a Person’s relationship with a foreign country. An FEC stores documentation and communication related to a Person’s foreign benefits for a foreign country as well as interactions between the Department and the foreign country relating to the person’s eligibility for Canadian benefits. A Person can have multiple FECs under their profile and each FEC is dedicated to one specific country. An FEC must be created under the Person’s profile when a person requests a foreign benefit from a different country, or when the Department sends or receives a foreign liaison requesting information. If an FEC for a specific country already exists, you can update the details within the specific FEC. If the Person does not exist in Cúram, you must add a Person profile. Refer to Register a Person in Cúram (Action) . You cannot delete an FEC in a Person’s record. However, you can choose to close the FEC when it is added in error. The status of the specific FEC will change from Open to Closed . When an FEC is created, the system automatically assigns the case to a processing work queue as the case owner. To close an FEC, you must be a supervisor. To view the owners of an FEC, go to the User Roles page under the Administration tab. The page lists all the case owners. When the new case owner is assigned, the previous case owner will be updated with an end date. The information in each FEC is categorized into 7 tabs: Table 1 — Tab Name and Detail Tab Name Details Home The Home tab consists of 2 pages: Home Urgent Flags The Home page shows the overview of the FEC. The Urgent Flags page lists the tasks with urgent flags. Tasks The Tasks tab displays the tasks related to the specific FEC. Foreign Benefits The Foreign Benefits tab consists of the following pages: Foreign Applications Foreign Liaisons Attachments The Foreign Applications page lists the foreign benefit applications in the FEC. To view the details of each application, click the toggle icon ( &gt; ) to expand the item. You can also create a Foreign Benefit Application from this page. Refer to Foreign Benefit Application—Add, View, Modify, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . The Foreign Liaisons page lists the records of all incoming and outgoing liaisons in the FEC. This page also lists the cross reference to any related foreign benefit applications to the outgoing liaison. To view the details of each liaison, click the arrow icon to expand the item. You can also add a liaison record from this page. Refer to Liaison—Add, Modify, Access and Delete in Cúram (Action) . The Attachments page lists all the attachments associated with the FEC. To view the details of each attachment, click on the arrow icon to expand the item. You can also add an attachment from this page. Refer to Attachments—Add, View, Modify, Delete, Move and Search in Cúram (Action) . Contacts The Contacts tab includes the Communication page which contains enquiries and letters sent to clients. However, it will not contain any communication with the foreign countries. To view a communication or correspondence item, under Regarding Case Member , select a case member or select All . Select Search to open the related communication item. Select the arrow icon to expand each item to view the details. You can capture communication or create a correspondence from this page. Refer to: Capture Communication — Process an Enquiry Related to a Person or A Foreign Engagement Case in Cúram (Action) ; and Correspondence—Create, Update, and Check Status in Cúram (Action) . Evidence The Evidence tab stores case-specific evidence information. It consists of the following pages: Dashboard Active Evidence In Edit Evidence Evidence Exceptions Verifications Issues Incoming Evidence The Dashboard page allows you to enter applicable data to the Canadian Residence Period , Foreign Contribution Period, Foreign Residence Period, Restricted Date of Death, Unstructured Foreign Contribution Period and Unstructured Foreign Residence Period sections. Once you enter the residence or contribution information, you must activate the information after it is verified. Refer to Foreign Creditable Period—Add, View, Edit or Delete in Cúram (Action) or Residence Period—Add, View and Edit in Cúram (Action) . The Active Evidence page lists periods of residence or contribution that have been activated. The In Edit Evidence page lists periods of residence or contribution that have not been activated. The Verifications page lists items that require verification in the FEC. The Issues page lists system-identified evidence issues in the FEC. The Incoming Evidence page lists evidence shared from other FECs or from the Person’s profile. Participants The Participants tab consists of the following pages: Case Members Case Participants The Case Members page lists all related clients. The Case Participants page lists clients, as well as verified and unverified third party contacts, if applicable. Administration The Administration tab consists of the following pages: Transaction History User Roles The Transaction History page documents all the transactions with details in the FEC. The User Roles page lists to whom the case is assigned to. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: View a Foreign Engagement Case In Cúram, access the Person’s record. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) will be listed under Current Cases on the bottom right of the Home tab on the Person’s account. Click the case number hyperlink from the Reference column next to the specific FEC. The FEC home page opens in a new tab in the tab title bar. H2 Exp-coll: Add a Foreign Engagement Case In Cúram, access the Person’s record. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) will be listed under Current Cases on the bottom right of the Home tab on the Person’s account. Click the 3-dots ( ... ) action menu at the top right of the context panel and click New Foreign Engagement Case… . The New Foreign Engagement Case wizard opens. Select the foreign country related to this case. Note: This step is mandatory. You can also enter the name of the country in the field. Click Save . The FEC home page opens in a new tab in the tab title bar. H2 Exp-coll: Edit a Foreign Engagement Case In Cúram, access the Person’s record. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Any Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) will be listed under Current Cases on the bottom right of the Home tab on the Person’s account. Click the Case Number hyperlink from the Reference column next to the specific FEC. The FEC home page opens in a new tab. Click Edit Foreign Engagement Case… at the top right of the context panel. The Edit Foreign Engagement Case wizard opens. Select a new country under the Country drop-down menu. Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . The FEC will change to the new country. Note : You can only edit the country of the FEC when there are no active foreign applications and/or foreign liaisons under the FEC. If any work has been actioned and sent, you must add a new FEC for the new country. H2 Exp-coll: Close a Foreign Engagement Case In Cúram, access the Person’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Foreign Engagement Cases (FEC) will be listed under Current Cases on the bottom right of the Home tab on the Person’s account. Click the Case Number hyperlink from the Reference column next to the specific FEC. The FEC home page opens in a new tab. Click the 3-dots ( ... ) action menu at the top right of the context panel and click Close Case… . The Close Case wizard opens. Select Created in error under the Reason drop down menu. Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . Top tab: References</content></document><document><reference>https://kmt-ogc.service.gc.ca/en/knowledgebase/article-latest?pid=KA-05527&amp;cid=CAT-02019</reference><title>Tax Slips — Create, Modify, Delete, Amend, Issue, Cancel, Reverse Cancellation and Issue Duplicate in Cúram (Action)</title><video_link>[-1]</video_link><video_name>['placeholder']</video_name><walkme_flow_id>[-1]</walkme_flow_id><walkme_flow_name>['placeholder']</walkme_flow_name><content>Overview Summary This procedure provides you with the steps to produce tax slips in Cúram. This can involve actions such as create, modify, delete, amend, issue, cancel, and reverse cancellation of T4 or NR4 tax slip. What you need to know There are 3 types of tax slips: Table 1. Types of tax slips and their description Tax slip Description T4A (OAS) This tax slip is generated for clients who received any payment in Canada or to deemed residents. NR4 (OAS) This tax slip is generated for clients who received any OAS pension payment outside of Canada. This will show up as NR4 OAS form. NR4 (OAS) (ITB) This tax slip is generated for clients who received any income-tested benefits payments outside of Canada. This will show up as an NR4 OAS form. Note: A client may receive both an NR4 (OAS) and NR4 (ITB) NR4 if applicable. Tax slips are categorized as Original , Amended , or Cancelled , and their progress can be tracked through different issuance statuses such as Submitted , Issued , Draft and Deleted . Table 2. Tax slip categories Tax Slip Category Description Original This is the original state that a specific type and year of tax slip (i.e. T4A(OAS), 2023) was generated in for a given client. Amended Amended tax slips indicates changes made to the financial data generated for a specific client, tax slip form type, and tax year after the tax slip has been issued. If you are only reissuing a tax slip to a new address or authorized person, you should not be issuing an amended tax slip, rather you should issue a duplicate tax slip. Cancelled If you see the “Cancelled” category on a tax slip, this means that a tax slip was cancelled due to not having valid data or it was issued in error. New Note: When issuing a tax slip after an address change, the old address will still appear on the duplicate request in Cúram. The system will automatically send the duplicate to the new address on file. Table 3. Tax Slip Issuance Status Tax Slip Issuance Status Description Submitted This status indicates that tax slip data has been generated but has not yet been processed or released. This status indicates that the tax slip is ready to be picked up for processing by the CRA/MRQ (Canada Revenue Agency / Ministry of Revenue Quebec) interface batch jobs and print batch. Issued The tax slip has been processed or released to CRA/MRQ and to printing or Universal Access. This issuance status is not picked by the CRA/MRQ batch for processing. No further changes can be made to this version of the tax slip. It  can only be amended or cancelled or issued (duplicate). Draft Tax slip data has been generated but is not yet ready to be processed or released. The tax slip should not be picked up for processing by the tax slip interface batch jobs. Deleted The tax slip version has been logically deleted. Deleted tax slip versions will no longer be visible. Note: If a duplicate has been created, the issuance status will show up with (duplicate) (e.g. Issued (Duplicate) ) You can view and modify the tax slips through several action items: Table 4. Action Items Action Item Description Duplicate and Issue The Duplicate and Issue action allows you to reissue a tax slip to the client. This can only happen if the financial data has not changed. Create The Create action allows you to start a new tax slip after one has been deleted or cancelled. When you select the Create action, the Create Tax Slip wizard opens. This is only available when the issuance status is Deleted or Cancelled , and can only be created for a tax year after the last business day of that tax year, and no tax slips already exists for that year. This does not include actions on deceased clients, which may be performed at any time. Edit The Edit action allows you to modify an existing tax slip. When you select the Edit action, the Edit Tax Slip wizard opens. Delete The Delete action allows you to remove a tax slip that is not in its final state. When you select the Delete action, a confirmation dialog box opens. Amend The Amend action allows you to make changes to a tax slip that has been officially issued. When you select the Amend action, the Amend Tax Slip wizard opens. This is only used when financial data needs to be changed. Cancel The Cancel action allows you to invalidate a tax slip that has been issued but needs to be cancelled. When you select the Cancel action, a Cancel Tax Slip wizard opens. The cancellation of OAS tax slips is a new functionality with the migration to Cúram. Note: Agents should use E-forms for all T4 and NR4 creation, amendment, or duplicate requests for years 2022 and prior. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: View an original or an amended tax slip In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click on the Financials tab. Click on the Tax Slips in the page group navigation bar on the left. Click on Previous YTD to see the previous year to date information. Click on Current YTD to view year to date information. Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon to display more information related to the tax slip. H2 Exp-coll: Issue an original or an amended tax slip In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click on the Financials tab. Click on the Tax Slips page from the left side menu. Click on the 3 dots ( … ) action menu on the original or amended tax slip, then click Issue . Click on Yes in the popup window. Click on Save to return to the Tax Slips Page. H2 Exp-coll: Create an original tax slip In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click on the Financials tab. Click on the Tax Slips page from the left side menu. Click on the 3 dots ( ... ) page action menu. Click on Create . Enter the following tax slip information: Year Method Type of Slip Click Next . The Create Tax Slip section opens. Enter in the accurate values for each box number under Details. Click Save to save a draft, or click Save and Issue to directly issue the newly created slip. H2 Exp-coll: Edit an original or an amended tax slip In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click on the Financials tab. Click on the Tax Slips page from the left side menu. Click on the 3 dots ( … ) action menu on the original or amended tax slip, then click Edit . The Edit Tax Slip wizard opens. Scroll down to edit the tax slip on the Box Value bar. Click Save or Save and Issue in the popup window to return to the Tax Slips Page. H2 Exp-coll: Delete an original or an amended tax slip In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click on the Financials tab. Click on the Tax Slips page from the left side menu. Click on the 3 dots ( … ) action menu on the original or amended tax slip, then click Delete . Click Yes in the popup window to return to the Tax Slips Page. H2 Exp-coll: Cancel an original or an amended tax slip In Cúram, go to the client’s profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click on the Financials tab. Click on the Tax Slips page from the left side menu. Click on the 3 dots ( … ) action menu on the original or amended tax slip, then click Cancel . The Cancel Tax Slip wizard appears. What you need to know Mismatches on the case record occur when there are discrepancies between the information stored in Cúram and ITRDS . These mismatches can happen for any information in the case record (e.g. bank account details, phone records, third-party contact evidence for representatives). If there is an error in matching data, the system sends an error response code. Subsequently, the error code may generate a task in Cúram. This information will assist you to validate mismatched case records with ITRDS . The following are examples of mismatch tasks: Example 1: Mismatched bank account details A mismatch may occur when a future-dated bank account exists for a client in Cúram and the system receives an event update from ITRDS . The client account will need to be reviewed when there is a transactional event update from ITRDS to delete future-dated bank account or if there is a mismatch with existing future-dated bank account (i.e. financial institution number, branch transit number and account number). You must review the client's account information before manually closing the task. Example 2: Mismatched phone records There may be a mismatch when the system cannot match an existing current or future-dated phone record in Cúram with a transactional event update from ITRDS to delete phone record. A mismatch task would be created when the matching criteria (i.e. type, start date, phone number) do not match between Cúram and the ITRDS update. Based on this review you must decide whether to add, modify or delete the correct phone number to resolve the mismatch. Table 1 — Cúram to ITRDS Telephone mapping Cúram ITRDS Personal Landline 1 – Home Personal Mobile 3 – Cell Business Landline 2 – Business Personal Teletypewriter (TTY) 7 – Device for the Deaf Business Mobile 8 – Other Business Teletypewriter 8 – Other Example 3: Mismatched third-party representative evidence When Cúram cannot match a third-party representative evidence record with the transactional event update from ITRDS , a task will be created to update the third-party contact information. You must review and update the relevant contact details to ensure the case record is accurate. Note that only the representative role is shared between Cúram and ITRDS . No other third-party representative role is shared or can be mismatched. However, it is possible to have 2 separate third party contacts for a single client in Cúram (i.e. Trustee and Power of Attorney). Also, there are no mismatch tasks surrounding Third Party Contacts between ITRDS and Cúram. A mismatch on this would likely be a system-based mismatch because Cúram was not sending the correct or enough information for ITRDS to retrieve the correct record. Example 4: Mismatched future-dated addresses A mismatch for future-dated addresses may occur when an ITRDS update is received but there is a difference in the effective date of the address change or there are multiple future-dated addresses. The client account must be reviewed, and information must be evaluated to determine if ITRDS updates must be applied or identify the correct future-dated address to be deleted. Example 5: Mismatched death match If there is a mismatch of date of death with ITRDS or if there's no date of death in Cúram, the date of death must be reviewed. The date of death evidence record on the person profile must be updated based on the event update from ITRDS . Example 6: Mismatched marital status A CRA Marital Status Mismatch task is created for verification when a mismatch with CRA Marital Status and Marital Relationship evidence do not match. If Cúram receives marital status information from the CRA and the details do not match with the existing CRA marital status evidence in the client’s profile, Cúram will update the CRA marital status evidence with the new details from the CRA. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do Review the mismatch task In Cúram, click the Inbox tab. Click the Shortcuts panel on the left. Click My Tasks under Tasks. Click the Task hyperlinkunder Work Stopped / Work Not Started. The homepage of the task opens. Review the task information available within the Task window. Multiple fields are available (e.g. Subject , Skill Type , Category and Type ). Additionally, there will be links within the Primary Action that can provide further information. Table 2 — Information allocated to specific Task Tabs Tab Name Details Home This tab lists applicable hyperlinks under Primary Action and Supporting Information . Links under Primary Action direct you to carry out the primary action of the task. Links under Supporting Information direct you to supplemental information (e.g. Person Home which will directly review the Person’s records). History and Comments This tab records all the change actions on this task. You can also see comments entered on the task. Assignments This tab lists whom the task is assigned to. Time Worked This tab lists the time worked on the task and by who. Review mismatched information on Cúram and ITRDS . Update the incorrect record in Cúram, if required. Refer to Manage a Person Record in Cúram (Action) for further instruction on how to update person records within Cúram. Once updated, complete the task in Cúram. Refer to Manage Tasks in Cúram (Action) . Top tab: References There is no reference material. (KA-01423 Snippet 14.0 content. Do not modify or delete.)</content></document><document><reference>https://kmt-ogc.service.gc.ca/en/knowledgebase/article-latest?pid=KA-05543&amp;cid=CAT-02017</reference><title>Restricted Date of Death Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action)</title><video_link>[-1]</video_link><video_name>['placeholder']</video_name><walkme_flow_id>[-1]</walkme_flow_id><walkme_flow_name>['placeholder']</walkme_flow_name><content>Overview Summary This procedure provides you with the steps to add and manage for a client in Cúram. What you need to know There are 3 International Social Security Agreement (ISSA) countries (United States, Japan, and Jamaica) with information sharing restriction that do not allow any information, including the date of death that is received on a Foreign Liaison form to be shared outside of International Operations (IO). Refer to International Operations — Sharing information obtained under an International Social Security Agreement (Knowledge) for more information if needed. Due to the restrictions that do not allow the information to be shared outside of IO, this evidence is to be created on the Foreign Engagement Case (FEC) so that the date of death received remains restricted. Once the evidence is created on the FEC, it only applies to Canadian benefits processed under an ISSA. If the date of death is reported or verified by a non-restricted source in the future (e.g. confirmed or reported by NOK, death certificate, or other) the date of death can then be updated on the person record. Before entering a date of death on the Restricted FEC, you must verify that a date of death is not already recorded on the person. If the date of death on the person and the date of death on the liaison is different, you must verify the date of death prior to entering the date of death on the Restricted FEC. Cúram does not restrict you from adding a date of death on the Person’s profile and on the FEC. If a “Birth or Death details” evidence or “Restricted Date of Death” evidence is activated and date of death on the 2 evidence does not match, then a task will be generated to review the date of death. This task will be sent to the IO User as they have access to both the Person level Date of Death and the Restricted Date of Death. Different dates of death received from restricted countries Different dates of death may be received from restricted countries. In such cases, only the correct date of death must be captured in the system as evidence. If any previously captured date is incorrect, the evidence must be deleted, and a new restricted date of death evidence should be created. For example, you initially capture and activate the first received restricted date of death evidence. Later, the department receives another restricted date of death from one of the other two restricted countries. If the date matches the previously captured one, no further action is needed. However, if the date differs, you must conduct research to determine the correct date of death. If the previously captured date is confirmed to be correct, no further steps are required. If the new date is determined as correct, you must delete the existing Restricted Date of Death evidence and apply changes. After applying changes, you must capture the new ‘Restricted Date of Death’ evidence with the correct date of death and apply changes. Date of Death Mandatory Select the date of death from the calendar. Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . The Restricted Date of Death evidence is created on the Foreign Engagement Case. H2 Exp-coll: Activate a restricted date of death evidence In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click the hyperlink in front of the Foreign Engagement Case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab. Click the 3-dots ( ... ) action menu and click Apply Changes… . The Apply Changes window opens. Check the box for the Restricted Date of Death evidence. Click Save . The Restricted Date of Death evidence is active and can be applied to Canadian benefits processed under an ISSA. H2 Exp-coll: Delete restricted date of death evidence In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Refer to the Activate a Restricted Date of Death evidence section above to apply the changes to the evidence. Top tab: References There is no reference material. (KA-01423 Snippet 14.0 content. Do not modify or delete.)</content></document><document><reference>https://kmt-ogc.service.gc.ca/en/knowledgebase/article-latest?pid=KA-05545&amp;cid=CAT-02018</reference><title>ALW/ALWS Conversion to OAS Approve/Prevent (Action)</title><video_link>[-1]</video_link><video_name>['placeholder']</video_name><walkme_flow_id>[-1]</walkme_flow_id><walkme_flow_name>['placeholder']</walkme_flow_name><content>Overview Summary This procedure provides you with the steps to convert an ALW or ALWS benefit to an OAS pension when the automated process fails. What you need to know Every month, Cúram will: identify clients who need a conversion record; create this record; and set an automated conversion status based on certain criteria. These actions are performed by the system; no action is required for this creation to occur. At the start of every month, the system will create a task to be reviewed if: the client will turn 64+9 months or 65; and the client's Automated Conversion status is set to No ; and the client's Conversion Status is set to Pending . Once a conversion record has been created, it will be available on the ALW / ALWS conversion page. Note: At 64+9 months, the client's automated conversion status may be set to No because they have less than 40 years of residence in Canada on their ALW / ALWS benefit approval date, or because they are eligible but not entitled (or entitled to $0) for the ALW or ALWS benefit. Note: At the beginning of the month the client turns 65, their automated conversion status may be set to No because they are eligible but not entitled (or entitled to $0) for the ALW or ALWS benefit. Therefore, a task will be created at this time if the client has lost their entitlement between 64+9 months and 65. A new ALW / ALWS Conversion page will appear on the Administration tab of the client's Integrated Case only once a conversion record has been created by the system. Note: If a client already has OAS Pension Application Details with Auto-Enrolment as the method of application, they will move from ALW / ALWS to OAS/GIS through Auto-Enrolment rather than through the conversion process. H2 Exp-coll: Conversion for clients with 40ths When converting clients, identify their current number of 40ths by reviewing the 40th override. on the Integrated Case. Based on the number of 40ths, follow the procedures below in addition to the standard conversion procedures. For more information, refer to Eligibility and Entitlement Override Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . H2 Exp-coll: Conversion for Clients with 40ths override equal to 40 You do not have to modify any overrides. At the time of conversion (i.e. the end of the month where the Client turns 65), the following will occur: The System will create Is Eligible Override for the OAS Pension and GIS, with a start date of the month after the Client turns 65. The System will create the Is Entitled override for the OAS Pension and GIS, with a start date of the month after the Client turns 65. The System will create an Actuarially Adjusted Months override with a value of 0, to comply with system rules that a 40ths override must always be accompanied by an Actuarially Adjusted Months Override. H2 Exp-coll: Conversion for Clients with 40ths override less than 40 At the time of conversion (i.e. the end of the month where the Client turns 65), the following will occur: The System will create Is Eligible Override for the OAS Pension and GIS, with a start date of the month after the Client turns 65. The System will create the Is Entitled override for the OAS Pension and GIS, with a start date of the month after the Client turns 65. However, you must also: add the residence period evidence since the age of 18 (with the combination of information provided in the initial ALW or ALWS benefit application and the Conversion Application (OAS/GIS) (ISP-3045) form; and delete the 40ths override. This will allow Cúram to automatically calculate the number of 40ths for the OAS pension and the GIS and facilitate long-term maintenance of the account in case of future recalculations. H2 Exp-coll: Clients suspended prior to migration New If a migrated account is only suspended due to their income being over the threshold, you must add an Is Entitled override for the ALW or ALWS benefit based on the benefit type the client is currently eligible for. The Start Date and End Date of this override should match the Start Date and End Date of the Is Eligible override on the OAS case. At the time of conversion, this will allow the system to convert the Is Entitled to the ALW or ALWS benefit override to the Is Entitled to OAS Pension and Is Entitled to GIS, allowing for entitlement to be paid for the OAS Pension, and for GIS when the client’s income is reduced to below the income threshold. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do Convert ALW / ALWS to OAS In Cúram, click on the Inbox tab. Click on the task in question with the OAS - Applications - Conversion Review type. Refer to Manage Tasks in Cúram (Action) . Under the Supporting Information table, click on Case Home . Click the Administration tab. Click ALW / ALWS Conversion in the page group navigation bar on the left. Examine the Conversion Details (including the Conversion Status and the Automated Conversion status), the Comments , and the Conversion Status History of this conversion record. Select the 3 dots ( … ) action menu to the right of the ALW / ALWS Conversion page. Select the appropriate status and proceed accordingly: Table 1 - Statuses Status Details and direction Approve Conversion Under the Action menu, you can view and select the "Approve Conversion" action if the Conversion Status is Pending or Pending - Prevent Conversion . Enter comments as needed. The Approve Conversion window will appear. Click Save to set the Conversion Status to Pending - Convert . Note: When the conversion status is set to Pending - Convert , the system will convert the client at the end of the month of their 65th birthday, regardless of the automated conversion status. Prevent Conversion In the Action menu, you can view and select the Prevent Conversion action if the Conversion Status is set to Pending or Pending - Convert . Enter comments as needed. Click Save to prevent the conversion to OAS. The status is set to Pending - Prevent Conversion . Note: When the conversion status is set to Pending - Prevent Conversion , the system will not convert the client at the end of the month of their 65th birthday, regardless of the automated conversion status. This conversion status can be changed anytime until the completion of conversion by the system. Reset Conversion In the Action menu, you can view and select the Reset Conversion action if the Conversion Status is Pending - Convert or Pending - Prevent Conversion . Enter in comments explaining this choice. They are mandatory for this status. Cllick Save to reset the conversion status. The status changes to Pending . Note: When the conversion status is set to Pending , the system will convert the client at the end of the month of their 65th birthday only if the automated conversion status is set to Yes . It will not convert the client if the automated conversion status is set to No . Generally, you will not need to reset the conversion status, but you may need to if, for example, you previously changed the client's conversion status by mistake or information from the client that was believed to be validated is not. Once you've completed the conversion request, return to the task and mark it as complete. Refer to Manage Tasks in Cúram (Action) on navigating and working with tasks. What you need to know You can create a GIS application from a Person page or Prospect Person page. You can add a GIS application form with the information found in the Application for Guaranteed Income Supplement (ISP-3025-Internal, ISP-3025-External, ISP-3025B, ISP-3042, ISP-3043, ISP-3044). After you submit the application form, an Application Case link will be automatically created under the Cases and Applications tab. Refer to OAS/GIS Application Case—View, Authorize, Reopen and Print in Cúram (Action) . You can view the GIS application for more information associated with a client's application before starting the authorizing. An incomplete application can be submitted so that an Application Case is created to generate correspondence from the Application Case. You will manually send the correspondence associated with the tasks based on the information required to process the application. When there's an application with a spouse or common-law partner, it is necessary to capture their consent. If consent has already been provided on a previous application, it can be carried over to the new application. If no prior consent exists, new consent must be obtained before proceeding. The declaration information can be found in the Consent and Declaration evidence under the Evidence tab of the Application Case. You cannot delete a GIS Application Case. However, a client can request to cease the GIS. A client can also request to opt-out of auto enrolment of the GIS. If a client's OAS application was approved before the cutover (i.e. before March 1, 2025) but their GIS application was not, you must submit a standalone “Application for Guaranteed Income Supplement” to authorize the GIS. However, if you submit a new “Application for Old Age Security Pension and Guaranteed Income Supplement” instead, you must proceed with completing all necessary case work in the Application Case, including adding evidences, completing verifications, and resolving any outstanding tasks. The OAS benefit should then be authorized. Cúram will copy the relevant evidence to the migrated Integrated Case. You must then review the Integrated Case to ensure all evidence has been carried over to the Integrated Case and determine whether any overrides need to be updated or removed based on the information available. You can now authorize the GIS. Note: Authorizing the OAS pension will not generate a duplicate benefit, as Cúram maintains only one Integrated Case and one Product Delivery Case. New Note: An override should not be removed unless the entire residence history is updated based on information on file. You must add the full residence history that was submitted on the OAS application before authorizing the GIS, then an override can be removed. Refer to Special Qualifying Factor (Work Tool) . What you need to know An OAS / GIS Application Case is automatically created during the auto-enrolment process and a separate OAS / GIS Application Case is created for the GIS auto-enrolment process. The evidence required to support each auto-enrolment process is also created automatically. An OAS / GIS Application Case can be accessed from the person's profile. Refer to OAS/ GIS Application Case—View, Authorize, Reopen and Print in Cúram (Action) . You can view a client’s OAS and GIS auto-enrolment status on the automatic enrolment screen that is accessed from the OAS / GIS Application Case. The auto-enrolment screen is only accessible from the Application Case for clients that are auto enrolled. The link will not display if a client is not auto enrolled. The Automatic Enrolment screen displays the OAS auto-enrolment status and GIS auto-enrolment status, current and historical, so that you can see where the client is in each auto-enrolment process. You can also manually update either auto-enrolment status from the screen. The OAS / GIS Application Case created by each auto-enrolment process is automatically authorized at the beginning of the month that the client turns 65 years old. The auto-enrolment authorization process will send the entitlement award letter (ISP-3092) automatically. Note: After each OAS / GIS Application Case is authorized, the auto-enrolment process is considered complete. A client may be excluded from the auto-enrolment process automatically if an issue (e.g. evidence issue) is encountered, or if certain information changes (e.g. date of birth month or year changes) during automatic enrolment. You can also exclude a client from auto-enrolment manually if needed using the Edit OAS auto-enrolment status or GIS auto-enrolment status process. Updated A client may decide to opt out of auto-enrolment before the authorization process. You can see if a client has opted out by checking the status on the Application Details evidence. If a client has opted out via Client Portal, there are no steps required for processing until an application is received. If the client opts out via a letter, you will need to make this update before the month the client turns 65 to reflect the client has opted out of auto-enrolment. Identity Confirmed When a client is selected for OAS auto-enrolment or GIS auto-enrolment, their identity is confirmed and verified in ITRDS /EDB before the auto-enrolment process starts in Cúram. As a result, a client that is auto-enrolment for OAS or GIS is considered verified so none of the evidence requires verification during auto-enrolment. Any changes to the evidence (e.g. manually or a life event) will trigger a verification, if applicable, as per the standard process. Manual Intervention If a client’s auto-enrolment status is set to Manual Intervention , manually or automatically, then the remaining steps of the auto-enrolment process must be completed manually up until authorization. When doing this, set the client’s auto-enrolment status to Waiting for Authorization as the last step in the process. After this, the auto-enrolment authorization process will complete the process. You must generate correspondence manually for all the steps you complete during manual intervention. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: View OAS and GIS automatic enrolment details In Cúram, go to the person's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Application on the page group navigation bar on the left. The list of available applications opens. Click the hyperlink for the application under the Reference column. On the Home tab of the application case, click the Automatic Enrolment link. The Automatic Enrolment screen displays the following information: Table 1 — Automatic Enrolment Screen Fields Field Description OAS Auto-Enrolment Cluster Header OAS Automatic Enrolment Displays Yes when OAS AE Status = Auto Enrolled . Displays No when OAS AE Status = Excluded , otherwise it is blank. Eligibility Process Date The date the client is deemed eligible for OAS auto-enrolment in ITRDS /EDB. This date is provided in the OAS auto-enrolment file from ITRDS /EDB. OAS AE Completion Date The date the OAS auto-enrolment process completes (after authorization). OAS AE Status The current OAS auto-enrolment status for the client. Change… link: This link opens the screen to manually change the OAS AE Status . The link is only displayed if there is an OAS auto-enrolment status. OAS AE Exclusion Reason The reason that the client is excluded from OAS auto-enrolment. This field only displays when the status is Excluded . GIS Auto-Enrolment Cluster Header GIS Automatic Enrolment Displays Yes when GIS AE Status = Auto Enrolled . Displays No when GIS AE Status = Excluded , otherwise it is blank. GIS AE Completion Date The date the GIS auto-enrolment process completes (after authorization). GIS AE status The current GIS AE status for the client. Change… link: This link opens the screen to manually change the GIS AE status. The link is only displayed if there is a GIS AE status. GIS AE Exclusion Reason The reason that the client is excluded from GIS auto-enrolment. This field only displays when the status is Excluded . Auto-Enrolment Status History Cluster Header Pension Identifies which pension or benefit the status record is related to. AE Status The status that was in effect based on the effective date and time. Effective Date Time The date and time that the auto-enrolment status came into effect. Updated By The system or individual that updated the status. If the status was updated manually, the username will be displayed. Table 2 — Automatic Enrolment Statuses Status Description Ready for Intake Only used by OAS auto-enrolment to indicate that the client is ready to be picked up by the OAS auto-enrolment intake process. This is the first step in the OAS auto-enrolment process after the file has been received. Intake in progress Only used by OAS auto-enrolment to indicate that the OAS auto-enrolment intake process has started for the client. The intake process is used to match or register a client as a Person in Cúram, create the application case, and create the evidence on the application case. Ready for GIS AE Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the client is ready to be auto enrolled. This is the first step in the GIS auto-enrolment process after the GIS auto-enrolment file is received. GIS AE Initiated Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the GIS auto-enrolment process has been initiated for the client. During this step there is a check to confirm the client is still auto enrolled for OAS, and to ensure the client has not already applied for GIS (e.g. a paper application). Add to lifetime list Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the client has been added to the CRA lifetime list. The status remains at this status until the CRA has provided a response with the client’s income information. This step is skipped if the client is already on the CRA lifetime list. Validate CRA response Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to check the response from the CRA (income information), and validate the information provided. Validation includes steps such as checking that income information was provided successfully for the tax year, death code, bankruptcy status, and marital status. Check for Spouse Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to check if the client has a spouse, based on the response from the CRA, and to compare it with the Marital status in Cúram. If the client has a spouse, then the system checks if the spouse is already in Cúram. During this stage, the status may be set to Manual Intervention if the system finds the spouse in Cúram but is not able to create marital relationship evidence automatically. Request Spouse profile Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to retrieve the spousal information from ITRDS /EDB if the spouse is not found in Cúram. During this stage, the status may be set to Manual Intervention if the system encounters an error when attempting to send the spousal information from ITRDS /EDB to Cúram. Spouse profile received Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the spousal information was received from ITRDS /EDB. Spouse Added to Application Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the client’s spouse was successfully added to the Application Case and the marital relationship evidence was created successfully. Add Spouse to lifetime list Only used by GIS auto-enrolment when the spouse is added to the CRA lifetime list to receive their income information from the CRA. This step is skipped if the spouse is already on the CRA lifetime list. Validate Spouse CRA response Only used by GIS auto-enrolment to check the response from the CRA (income information), and validate the information provided. Validation includes steps such as checking that income information was provided successfully for the tax year, bankruptcy status, and death code. Manual Intervention Used by OAS auto-enrolment and GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the remaining auto-enrolment steps need to be completed manually. Once all the remaining steps are completed, including sending correspondence manually, then the status should be set to Waiting for Authorization . The authorization process should not be done manually. Setting the status to Waiting for Authorization will ensure that the authorization process will complete the process in the month that the client turns 65. Waiting for authorization Used by OAS auto-enrolment and GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the client has almost completed all the auto-enrolment steps. The only remaining step is the authorization process, which occurs at the beginning of the month that the client turns 65 years old. Auto Enrolled Used by OAS auto-enrolment and GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the client has been successfully auto enrolled. This is the last step of the auto-enrolment process after the Application Case has been authorized. Excluded Used by OAS auto-enrolment and GIS auto-enrolment to indicate that the client has been excluded from the OAS or GIS auto-enrolment process. An exclusion reason is provided to indicate why the client was excluded. H2 Exp-coll: Edit the OAS AE status or GIS AE status Updated In Cúram, go to the person's profile. Joint accounts As Cúram does not allow more than one client to receive pension payments in the same bank account unless the Bank Accounts Details are the same across these clients, you will receive an error message when you try to update or add bank account details if the information does not match. If you receive this error message, you must review the account to determine if the client has a spouse, common-law partner or a third party registered in Cúram. If this spouse, common-law partner or third party is receiving payments in the same account, their Bank Accounts evidence must be updated to match. When a payment has not been processed, refer to the Payments not issued section in the What you need to do section of the Step by Step tab. When a payment has been processed, the direct deposit information must not be edited for evidence preservation purposes. Refer to the Payments Issued section in the What you need to do section of the Step by Step tab. If the client has no spouse, or there is no third-party evidence recorded on the account, you must call the client to obtain information about the party who may be using the identical bank account. If you are unable to determine who may be using the same banking information as the client, send an enquiry via the NEXO Tool Internal link . Note: Do not disclose to the client that this bank account is already in use by another beneficiary. Instead, ask if the bank account the client submitted is for a joint account. If a task was received from the Call Centre with a request to update the direct deposit information, review the date of the request then intercept and redirect pending payments, as needed, to avoid returned payments. Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) receives data from Canadian financial institutions regarding changes to a client’s direct deposit information. Once PSPC verifies the Standard Payment System and performs updates, they will then create a Notice of Change File which is sent to the Department. When the Notice of Change is received from PSPC to update direct deposit information, Cúram attempts to automatically update the direct deposit information for clients. If Cúram is unable to automatically update the direct deposit information based on the Notice of Change, a task will be generated. You must review the client's information and manually add the direct deposit information. This will ensure that payment goes to the correct bank account.
