What you need to know The renewal of income-tested benefits is an annual process that occurs in July, which is the start of a new benefit payment period. If a client is eligible for an income-tested benefit and their income information from the previous calendar year has been received, Cúram will automatically process the renewal of the benefit. In addition to the renewal of benefits, several supporting activities are performed around the same time in Cúram. These activities include: reviewing existing overrides; sending appropriate correspondence (e.g. renewal notices, decision letters); reviewing income variances that may indicate inconsistencies between reported and actual income; and reconciling estimated income that was used for the prior benefit period with the actual income now received. Some clients may need to fill out a Statement of Income for the Guaranteed Income Supplement, the Allowance or Allowance for the Survivor for payment period of July (20XX) to June (20XX) with Information Sheet (ISP-3026) form to keep receiving their benefits. This usually happens when their income information is missing, because they have not filed a tax return, or they don't meet the eligibility rules for automatic renewal based on the information available (e.g. there is a bankruptcy reported by the CRA ). The ISP-3026 form is mailed in March to the address the client has on file at the end of the March accounting month. If the ISP-3026 form is not returned by late June, Cúram automatically sends a second form. If the ISP-3026 form is still not returned in time, benefit payments may be delayed starting in July. Before income-tested benefits are paid for the new payment period, Cúram goes through a process called "reversion", which takes place in June. This process includes: moving all new income information into the current income fields; deleting any data that is no longer needed from the previous payment period; calculating eligibility for the GIS, the ALW benefit, and the ALWS benefit based on the updated income; and capturing information for issuing entitlement correspondence. As part of the supporting activities during the renewal process, Cúram will automatically generate tasks based on pre-defined trigger conditions. These tasks are applied to the client profile which are assigned to processing agents to review and resolve. Below is a list of tasks that Cúram generates along with their associated trigger conditions: Situation Task Subject Task Type Client's total payment income for the June accounting month is $0; No base income for the most recent calendar year. &lt;SIN or Curam Reference Number&gt; - &lt;First Name&gt; &lt; Last Name&gt; - No renewal received and income was nil for the previous payment period. Renewal Follow-up - Income A bulk reassessment is triggered and the reassessment of eligibility does not complete successfully. &lt;SIN or Curam reference number&gt; - &lt;First name&gt; &lt;Last Name&gt; - The re-assessment of eligibility for &lt;Case Type&gt; &lt;Case Reference Number&gt; did not complete successfully. Review case and resolve. Renewal Reassessment Incomplete The CRA indicates the Client reported pre/post bankruptcy. Pre/Post bankruptcy reported for Person &lt;Matched Person Member ID&gt; CRA – GIS Take-Up CRA – Assessment and Reassessment The CRA indicates that the Client is deceased. CRA Reported Date of Death for Person &lt;Matched Person member ID&gt; CRA – Assessment and Reassessment The CPP/QPP Pre-match value is greater than pre-match. Declared CPP/QPP amount is above CRA Amount for &lt;Tax Year&gt; CRA – Income Validation(s) Total amount exceeds the year over year threshold between the provided tax year and the prior tax year. Year over year income variance threshold exceeded for &lt;Tax Year&gt; CRA – Income Validation(s) The total OAS Program Benefit Amount issued to the Client for the tax year equals any line or block amount. Potential inclusion of OAS benefit amounts for &lt;Tax Year&gt; CRA – Income Validation(s) Any calculated estimated block is not equal to the actual income block from the base calendar year income. Estimated Income for &lt;Year&gt; needs to be reconciled for &lt;Participant Name&gt; Estimated Income Reconciliation The client has one of the following overrides: GIS Entitlement Amount ALW Entitlement Amount ALWS Entitlement Amount Rate Table: GIS Single Rate Table: GIS Married/C-L to Pensioner Rate Table: GIS Married/C-L to non-Pensioner Rate Table: GIS Married/C-L to Allowance Recipient Marital Relationship and Partner Requirement Survivor Status Individual Payment Income Total Payment Income No end date on at least one of the overrides above or end date is on/after July 1st &lt;SIN or Curam Reference Number&gt; - &lt;First Name&gt; &lt; Last Name&gt; - Review overrides on &lt;Case Type&gt; &lt;Reference Number&gt; that extend past the current payment period. Override Determination Once a client meets all the necessary requirements (e.g. having pending tasks resolved or overrides cleared) Cúram will automatically proceed with renewing the benefits. The system continuously checks for these conditions and benefit renewal is triggered once the conditions are satisfied. If a client does not meet the eligibility requirements for renewal, Cúram will create a task for an agent to review and resolve. Once the task is completed and the eligibility requirements are met, Cúram will automatically renew the benefit. Tasks that are not part of the eligibility rules do not stop the renewal of income-tested benefits. The ITB For Life status is automatically updated to Yes as a result of the eligibility determination process. Correspondence plays an important role in the renewal process. Cúram automatically sends letters to clients to ensure they have the information they need and that renewals are completed on time. Below is a list of correspondence generated by Cúram in July regarding the result of the renewal process: Correspondence Description GIS/ ALW / ALWS Entitlement Letter (ISP-3057) Renewal award letter for all income-tested benefits informing the client of their new entitlement amount and the payment income used to calculate the entitlement. GIS Suspension Letter (ISP-3067) Letter to inform clients that their new payment income puts them above the income threshold for GIS, thus making them not entitled for the benefit. ALW / ALWS Suspension Letter (ISP-3068) Letter to inform clients that their new payment income puts them above the income threshold for ALW or ALWS , making them not entitled for the benefit. GIS/ ALW / ALWS Non-Entitlement Letter (ISP-3056) Letter to inform clients that they are still not entitled to the income-tested benefit. Top tab: Reference There is no reference material. Medical CPPD Operational Policy - Non-Medical OAS Operational Policy OAS Legislation Knowledge Delegation of Authorities System Actions System Actions ITRDS CPMS PWS Appeals PSCD SAP Cúram Resources and Tools Resources and Tools Understanding the KMT Announcements Benefits Toolbox BERT NEXO Bulletins Corporate Correspondence Tool EReference Library Forms and Letters Information Sharing Agreements System and Network Outages Training You are here: Home System Actions Cúram Work Tools Special Qualifying Factor (Work Tool) Special Qualifying Factor (Work Tool) Expand All The Special Qualifying Factor (SQF) helps determine how much income-tested benefits a client can receive when they have not reached 10 full years of Canadian residence after age 18. Since April 1996, clients may receive 1/10th of the full benefit for each full year of residence in Canada, up to a maximum of 10 years (i.e. the full benefit means an SQF of 1.0). How the SQF works Table 1. Client value and SQF value Client Type SQF Value OAS approved without an International Social Security Agreement (ISSA) with 10 years or more of Canadian residence 1.0 OAS approved with an ISSA with less than 10 years of Canadian residence 0.1 x each full year of residence (to a maximum of 1.0) The SQF increases by 0.1 each year as the client reaches their next anniversary date of residence. For example, a client that entered Canada on March 15 would reach a year of residence the next year on March 14. Therefore, March would be the anniversary month and the SQF would increase effective April. Cúram will consider Residence period evidence to calculate the SQF. In the absence of a Residence period evidence, an SQF override equal to the total Canadian residence to a maximum of 10 years can be entered. Cúram will then calculate the SQF correctly. Cúram considerations for migrated accounts Updated Updated The GIS New Business application asks for only 2 years of residence. If that is the only residence period evidence in Cúram, the system assumes that is the total residence for the SQF calculation. Table 2. Application, information entered and how the system assumes SQF Application Information Entered System Assumes SQF GIS New Business Last 2 years 0.2 This often underrepresents a client’s true residence history, leading to incorrect benefit entitlement. How to Fix the SQF (preferred order) Updated Update the residence period in Cúram. Refer to Residence Period—Add, View and Edit in Cúram (Action) . Note: This is the best option as it avoids future overrides and ensures accurate records. Verify internal notes (e.g. ITRDS , address history). Extend the residence history to start at or before the date required to meet the full SQF. Add the complete residence period history in Cúram. Refer to Residence Period—Add, View and Edit in Cúram (Action) . Note: This option will avoid future overrides and ensures accurate records, but can be time consuming and may result in processing delays. Verify internal notes (e.g. ITRDS , address history). Request the file for the full residence history. Add an entitlement override for the SQF. Refer to Eligibility and Entitlement Override Evidence—Add, Edit, View, and Delete in Cúram (Action) . Updated For OAS approved without an ISSA, enter an SQF of 10. Updated For OAS approved under an ISSA, enter an SQF of 1 to 10 based on the number of full years of Canadian residence at the start date of the override. Create an OAS - Maintenance/Override Determination task in Cúram and: Add "SQF review related" as a comment in the task. Bring forward for follow-up to review at the residence anniversary date. What you need to know Consent and Declaration evidence captures the applicant’s signature information. An applicant is: the individual applying for or requesting the benefit; or their legal representative applying for the benefit on their behalf. An applicant or their spouse or common-law partner must sign the application. If the applicant or their spouse or common-law partner signs with an “X”, it must be done in the presence of a witness. The witness must provide their name, address, telephone number, their relationship to the applicant, and sign and date the application. If a third party submits an application on behalf of an individual, they must also submit documentation to support that they are authorized to act on the individual's behalf, if it has not already been provided. For more information, refer to Third Party Requests (Scenario) . The Consent and Declaration evidence exists in the Application Case. When additional information is required for this evidence, Cúram will raise an issue on the evidence and create a task to verify the authorized person to block the benefit authorization at the time the application is submitted. You must verify that a valid authorized third party was previously added for the participant in question. Top tab: Step by Step What you need to do H2 Exp-coll: View Consent and Declaration Evidence details In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab. Click the hyperlink of the Consent and Declaration evidence under the Household section. The Evidence window opens. H2 Exp-coll: Add Consent and Declaration Evidence In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab. Hover over Consent and Declaration in the Household section and click the plus ( + ) icon. The New Consent and Declaration window opens. Enter the following details in the New Consent and Declaration window: Table 1—Field and Direction for the New Consent and Declaration window Field Direction Date Received Mandatory Review the Date Received : If the date is correct, leave the field as is. If the date is incorrect, select the correct date from the calendar. Participant Mandatory Select the client from the Participant drop-down menu. Signature Type Mandatory Select one of the following options: Signed Signed with a Mark Not Signed Date Signed Mandatory Select the date from the calendar. Witness or Authorized Person Participant Select the witness or authorized person if they are an existing case Participant in the drop-down menu. To register a related Participant in the Representative role type, use the name and address lookup function provided in the Witness or Authorized Person section. Note: You must select a Witness or Authorized Person Participant when the Signature Type is Signed with a Mark or Not Signed . Acting as a Witness Signing on Behalf Check the box in front of Acting as a Witness or Signing on Behalf . Note: You must check Acting as a Witness or Signing on Behalf when the Signature Type is Signed with a Mark or Not Signed . Relationship to Participant Select the appropriate person’s relationship to the client from the drop-down menu. Note: If the relationship to the applicant is not clear, you must select Other . Date Witness or Authorized Person Signed Select the correct date from the calendar. You must make a selection in the Date Witness or Authorized Person Signed calendar if you selected Signed with a Mark or Not Signed in the Signature Type drop-down menu. Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . H2 Exp-coll: Edit Consent and Declaration Evidence In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab. Click the Consent and Declaration link in the Household section. The Consent and Declaration window opens. Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon to show the Consent and Declaration evidence. Click Edit on the right side of the evidence. The Edit Consent and Declaration window opens. Make the necessary updates to the Consent and Declaration evidence. Note: If the incorrect witness or authorized person is added, you must delete the Consent and Declaration evidence and add new evidence. Table 2—Field and Direction for the Edit Consent and Declaration window Field Direction Date Received Mandatory Review the Date Received : If the date is correct, leave the field as is. If the date is incorrect, select the correct date from the calendar. Change Reason Mandatory Select the reason for changing the Consent and Declaration evidence. Signature Type Mandatory Select one of the following options: Signed Signed with a Mark Not Signed Date Signed Mandatory Select the date from the calendar. Acting as a Witness Signing on Behalf Check the box in front of Acting as a Witness or Signing on Behalf . Note: You must check Acting as a Witness or Signing on Behalf when the Signature Type is Signed with a Mark or Not Signed . Relationship to Participant Select the appropriate person’s relationship to the client from the drop-down menu. Note: If the relationship to the applicant is not clear, you must select Other . Date Witness or Authorized Person Signed Select the correct date from the calendar. You must make a selection in the Date Witness or Authorized Person Signed calendar if you selected Signed with a Mark or Not Signed in the Signature Type drop-down menu. Enter the comments in the Comments field, if applicable. Click Save . H2 Exp-coll: Delete Consent and Declaration Evidence In Cúram, go to the client's profile. Refer to Search for a Person in Cúram (Action) . Click the Cases and Applications tab. Click Applications on the page group navigation bar on the left. Click the hyperlink in front of the case in the Reference column. Click the Evidence tab. Click the Consent and Declaration link in the Household section. The Consent and Declaration window opens. Click the ( &gt; ) toggle icon to show the Consent and Declaration evidence. Click the 3-dots ( ... ) action menu and click Delete… . The Delete Active Evidence window opens. Click Yes to confirm the deletion of the evidence. Top tab: References There is no reference material. (KA-01423 Snippet 14.0 content.
